texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Introduction to the Procurement Framework
texts.text: Introduction to the Procurement Framework

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement Framework is a set of interrelated documents devised to help the Procurement Practitioners  in  their  work.  It  explains  the  recommended  approach  and  best  practices  for procurement operations.
texts.text: The Procurement Framework is a set of interrelated documents devised to help the Procurement Practitioners  in  their  work.  It  explains  the  recommended  approach  and  best  practices  for procurement operations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition of the Procurement
texts.text: Definition of the Procurement

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement is the support function that ensures identification, sourcing, and access to optimal goods, services and projects that the government entities and its End-users require to fulfil their objectives.
texts.text: The Procurement is the support function that ensures identification, sourcing, and access to optimal goods, services and projects that the government entities and its End-users require to fulfil their objectives.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement exists to explore supply market opportunities and to ensure optimal implementation of the sourcing strategies that deliver the best possible supply outcomes for the government entity.
texts.text: The Procurement exists to explore supply market opportunities and to ensure optimal implementation of the sourcing strategies that deliver the best possible supply outcomes for the government entity.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement adds value and helps the government entity accomplish its objectives by deploying a systematic, disciplined approach  to evaluate and  address its needs  collaboratively.  The Procurement  is  executed  through  a  series  of  activities  spanning  entire  supply  cycle  from  the understanding of requirements and evaluating the need for them, through identifying and analysing potential  supply  options,  up  to  contracting  with  Suppliers  and  fulfilment  of  contracts.  The Procurement runs continuously with ongoing management of relationships with the End-users, the Legal and the Finance, monitoring supply contracts and performance of Suppliers.
texts.text: The Procurement adds value and helps the government entity accomplish its objectives by deploying a systematic, disciplined approach  to evaluate and  address its needs  collaboratively.  The Procurement  is  executed  through  a  series  of  activities  spanning  entire  supply  cycle  from  the understanding of requirements and evaluating the need for them, through identifying and analysing potential  supply  options,  up  to  contracting  with  Suppliers  and  fulfilment  of  contracts.  The Procurement runs continuously with ongoing management of relationships with the End-users, the Legal and the Finance, monitoring supply contracts and performance of Suppliers.

texts.orig: Core Principles
texts.text: Core Principles

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Core  Principles  define  key  values  and  approaches  for  the  effectiveness  of  the  Procurement. The  Procurement  Practitioners  of  the  government  entity  and  every  supplier  engaged  by  it  in procurement  operations  must  adhere  to  the  Core  Principles  when  representing  the  government entity.
texts.text: The  Core  Principles  define  key  values  and  approaches  for  the  effectiveness  of  the  Procurement. The  Procurement  Practitioners  of  the  government  entity  and  every  supplier  engaged  by  it  in procurement  operations  must  adhere  to  the  Core  Principles  when  representing  the  government entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Code of Business Ethics
texts.text: Code of Business Ethics

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (1): Objectives and Scope of the Code of Business Ethics
texts.text: Article (1): Objectives and Scope of the Code of Business Ethics

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  Code  of  Business  Ethics  aims  to  establish  principles  and  rules  that  serve  as  a  moral constitution that regulates the work of the Procurement Practitioners in accordance with the business ethics expected in the procurement profession.
texts.text: The  Code  of  Business  Ethics  aims  to  establish  principles  and  rules  that  serve  as  a  moral constitution that regulates the work of the Procurement Practitioners in accordance with the business ethics expected in the procurement profession.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Code of Business Ethics promotes ethical behaviour and emphasises accountability of the Procurement  Practitioners  for  protecting  the  reputation  of  the  government  entity  they represent.  It  prevents  the  impropriety  and  unfair  business  conduct  in  procurement operations.
texts.text: The Code of Business Ethics promotes ethical behaviour and emphasises accountability of the Procurement  Practitioners  for  protecting  the  reputation  of  the  government  entity  they represent.  It  prevents  the  impropriety  and  unfair  business  conduct  in  procurement operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The provisions of the Code of Business Ethics shall apply to all Procurement Practitioners in the government entity that abides by the Standards.
texts.text: The provisions of the Code of Business Ethics shall apply to all Procurement Practitioners in the government entity that abides by the Standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (2): General Principles
texts.text: Article (2): General Principles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The execution of procurement on behalf of the government entity involves the expenditure of  funds.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  must  conduct  all  activities  to  achieve  sound commercial decisions with integrity and probity.
texts.text: The execution of procurement on behalf of the government entity involves the expenditure of  funds.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  must  conduct  all  activities  to  achieve  sound commercial decisions with integrity and probity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Procurement Practitioners must be fully aware and act in accordance with the Code of Business  Ethics.  Violation  of  the  Code  of  Business  Ethics  due  to  lack  of  awareness  of  its contents shall not be acceptable.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must be fully aware and act in accordance with the Code of Business  Ethics.  Violation  of  the  Code  of  Business  Ethics  due  to  lack  of  awareness  of  its contents shall not be acceptable.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The Procurement Practitioners must immediately report any contravention of the Code of Business Ethics to their direct manager or the head of the Procurement to verify and take the necessary action.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must immediately report any contravention of the Code of Business Ethics to their direct manager or the head of the Procurement to verify and take the necessary action.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The Procurement Practitioners found in contravention of the Code of Business Ethics shall be held accountable for their actions and will be liable for disciplinary or legal action based on the situation and applicable legislations.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners found in contravention of the Code of Business Ethics shall be held accountable for their actions and will be liable for disciplinary or legal action based on the situation and applicable legislations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The  Code  of  Business  Ethics  establishes  the  following  eight  principles  that  assure  ethical procurement:
texts.text: The  Code  of  Business  Ethics  establishes  the  following  eight  principles  that  assure  ethical procurement:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (3): Fiduciary Responsibility
texts.text: Article (3): Fiduciary Responsibility

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners must act in the best interest of the government entity they represent and ensure required goods, services and projects are procured providing expected value to the government entity.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must act in the best interest of the government entity they represent and ensure required goods, services and projects are procured providing expected value to the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Procurement Practitioners must carry out the duties and responsibilities assigned to them in accordance with the Procurement Standards.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must carry out the duties and responsibilities assigned to them in accordance with the Procurement Standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (4): Compliance with Applicable Legislations
texts.text: Article (4): Compliance with Applicable Legislations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners must conduct all procurement activities in compliance with the local and federal legislations.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must conduct all procurement activities in compliance with the local and federal legislations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  ensure  that  engaged  Suppliers  adhere  to  local  and federal  legislations,  health,  safety  and  environment  regulations  when  dealing  with  the government entity.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  ensure  that  engaged  Suppliers  adhere  to  local  and federal  legislations,  health,  safety  and  environment  regulations  when  dealing  with  the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  inform  the  relevant  administrative  authorities  of  any violation of the provisions of the applicable legislations by a Supplier.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  inform  the  relevant  administrative  authorities  of  any violation of the provisions of the applicable legislations by a Supplier.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (5): Professional Integrity
texts.text: Article (5): Professional Integrity

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners shall conduct themselves with highest standards of integrity and  must  not  exhibit  the  intent  or  appearance  of  unethical  or  compromising  conduct  in relationships, actions or communications.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall conduct themselves with highest standards of integrity and  must  not  exhibit  the  intent  or  appearance  of  unethical  or  compromising  conduct  in relationships, actions or communications.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  not  misuse  their  official  positions,  dispense  special favours or make private promises on behalf of the government entity they represent.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  not  misuse  their  official  positions,  dispense  special favours or make private promises on behalf of the government entity they represent.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The Procurement Practitioners must be impartial in carrying out procurement activities to ensure  that  all  stakeholders  have  confidence  in  the  results,  and  must  demonstrate  good procurement practices, accountability and stop purchases in case  of violation or suspicion of such.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must be impartial in carrying out procurement activities to ensure  that  all  stakeholders  have  confidence  in  the  results,  and  must  demonstrate  good procurement practices, accountability and stop purchases in case  of violation or suspicion of such.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (6): Conflicts of Interest
texts.text: Article (6): Conflicts of Interest

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners must manage and avoid conflicts of interests proactively.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must manage and avoid conflicts of interests proactively.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Procurement Practitioners shall immediately disclose personal interests and conflicting roles or roles with potential conflicts that may affect or might reasonably be seen by others to affect the integrity of decisions to their direct managers or the head of the Procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall immediately disclose personal interests and conflicting roles or roles with potential conflicts that may affect or might reasonably be seen by others to affect the integrity of decisions to their direct managers or the head of the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The  Procurement  Practitioners  are  prohibited  from  participating  in  any  decisions  or recommendations concerning individuals or institutions with which they have an existing or prospective Financial Interest.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  are  prohibited  from  participating  in  any  decisions  or recommendations concerning individuals or institutions with which they have an existing or prospective Financial Interest.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The  Procurement  Practitioners  must  not  grant  special  favours  or  treatment  and  avoid personal,  reciprocal  agreements  with  Suppliers.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  not accept gifts or anything of material or moral value.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  must  not  grant  special  favours  or  treatment  and  avoid personal,  reciprocal  agreements  with  Suppliers.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  not accept gifts or anything of material or moral value.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (7): Confidential Information
texts.text: Article (7): Confidential Information

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners must not disclose confidential or proprietary information for the personal or professional benefit.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must not disclose confidential or proprietary information for the personal or professional benefit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Sensitive information related to spend, contracts, pricing, sourcing events, Supplier performance, commercial and strategic planning must be kept confidential and disclosed only to the authorised personnel, maintaining an electronic audit trail.
texts.text: Sensitive information related to spend, contracts, pricing, sourcing events, Supplier performance, commercial and strategic planning must be kept confidential and disclosed only to the authorised personnel, maintaining an electronic audit trail.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The Procurement Practitioners shall be responsible for safeguarding financial, proprietary and other confidential information provided by Suppliers to the government entity.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall be responsible for safeguarding financial, proprietary and other confidential information provided by Suppliers to the government entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (8): Fair Relationships
texts.text: Article (8): Fair Relationships

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners shall promote positive Supplier relationships to maintain a competitive procurement environment by treating all Suppliers equally and fairly.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall promote positive Supplier relationships to maintain a competitive procurement environment by treating all Suppliers equally and fairly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Procurement Practitioners shall not exert undue or coercive influence over Suppliers to supply  at  prices  below  the  cost  or  deliberately  establish  terms  resulting  in  a  loss  to  the Suppliers or exclusion of any of them.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall not exert undue or coercive influence over Suppliers to supply  at  prices  below  the  cost  or  deliberately  establish  terms  resulting  in  a  loss  to  the Suppliers or exclusion of any of them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (9): Environmental Responsibility
texts.text: Article (9): Environmental Responsibility

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Procurement Practitioners shall consider the concept of sustainability to avoid adverse social and environmental impact of the goods, services and projects procured.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall consider the concept of sustainability to avoid adverse social and environmental impact of the goods, services and projects procured.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The Procurement Practitioners shall strive to purchase goods, services and projects that meet environmental regulations and they shall challenge the demand to purchase and consume optimally by eradicating wasteful practices.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall strive to purchase goods, services and projects that meet environmental regulations and they shall challenge the demand to purchase and consume optimally by eradicating wasteful practices.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Where applicable, the Procurement Practitioners shall offer assistance to Suppliers in raising their environmental awareness in accordance with applicable local and federal environmental legislations.
texts.text: Where applicable, the Procurement Practitioners shall offer assistance to Suppliers in raising their environmental awareness in accordance with applicable local and federal environmental legislations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Article (10): Professionalism
texts.text: Article (10): Professionalism

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The  Procurement  Practitioners  must  conduct  themselves  professionally  and  apply  high professional  standards  while  performing  work,  thereby  contributing  to  the  efficient  and professional execution of their responsibilities. The Procurement Practitioners must observe the following:
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  must  conduct  themselves  professionally  and  apply  high professional  standards  while  performing  work,  thereby  contributing  to  the  efficient  and professional execution of their responsibilities. The Procurement Practitioners must observe the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Be familiar with the Procurement Framework
texts.text: Be familiar with the Procurement Framework

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Be familiar with applicable legislations which the government entity is subject to
texts.text: Be familiar with applicable legislations which the government entity is subject to

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Exercise necessary professional attention in the execution and supervision of procurement operations and the preparation of reports
texts.text: Exercise necessary professional attention in the execution and supervision of procurement operations and the preparation of reports

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Maintain professional competence through continuing professional development
texts.text: Maintain professional competence through continuing professional development

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment Standards
texts.text: Establishment Standards

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Establishment Standards explain the overall Procurement Framework defined to promote the practice of professional procurement. The Establishment Standards set the purpose and objectives of the Procurement Standards, their structure and management approach.
texts.text: The Establishment Standards explain the overall Procurement Framework defined to promote the practice of professional procurement. The Establishment Standards set the purpose and objectives of the Procurement Standards, their structure and management approach.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 1: Purpose, Scope and Structure of the Procurement Standards
texts.text: Section 1: Purpose, Scope and Structure of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1.1. Purpose of the Procurement Standards
texts.text: 1.1. Purpose of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Standards  set  out  principles  and  operating  rules  for  running  procurement operations. They offer information on the leading practices and professional requirements.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Standards  set  out  principles  and  operating  rules  for  running  procurement operations. They offer information on the leading practices and professional requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: They aim to ensure consistency and professionalism in everyday procurement activities. The Procurement Practitioners abiding by the Procurement Standards positively influence the value for money for the government entity they represent.
texts.text: They aim to ensure consistency and professionalism in everyday procurement activities. The Procurement Practitioners abiding by the Procurement Standards positively influence the value for money for the government entity they represent.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1.2. Scope of the Procurement Standards
texts.text: 1.2. Scope of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Standards  apply  to  individual  Procurement  Practitioners  as  well  as  the Procurement as an organisational function within the government entity.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Standards  apply  to  individual  Procurement  Practitioners  as  well  as  the Procurement as an organisational function within the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Standards apply to every purchase made by the government entity, for goods, services and projects regulated by price list agreements, contracts or orders.
texts.text: The Procurement Standards apply to every purchase made by the government entity, for goods, services and projects regulated by price list agreements, contracts or orders.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1.3. Structure of the Procurement Standards
texts.text: 1.3. Structure of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Standards  comprise  of  three  main  types:  Establishment,  Enablement,  and Execution.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Standards  comprise  of  three  main  types:  Establishment,  Enablement,  and Execution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. The Establishment Standards introduce the Procurement Framework and the Procurement Standards as its component and define the purpose, intended use and applicability. They assign responsibility and set the governance mechanism thereof.
texts.text: A1. The Establishment Standards introduce the Procurement Framework and the Procurement Standards as its component and define the purpose, intended use and applicability. They assign responsibility and set the governance mechanism thereof.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. The  Enablement  Standards  define  attributes  of  functions  and  individuals  practising procurement  and  describe  requirements  for  actors,  relations  and  setup  conditions  to procure efficiently. They introduce the Procurement as a function providing services to the requesting party or End-users.
texts.text: A2. The  Enablement  Standards  define  attributes  of  functions  and  individuals  practising procurement  and  describe  requirements  for  actors,  relations  and  setup  conditions  to procure efficiently. They introduce the Procurement as a function providing services to the requesting party or End-users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. The  Execution  Standards  define  the  way  of  working  and  expected  performance  of  the Procurement with the criteria against which to measure it. They split procurement into strategic, tactical and operational processes.
texts.text: A3. The  Execution  Standards  define  the  way  of  working  and  expected  performance  of  the Procurement with the criteria against which to measure it. They split procurement into strategic, tactical and operational processes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Standards as a document is organised into sections containing enumerated standards.
texts.text: The Procurement Standards as a document is organised into sections containing enumerated standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 2: Application of the Procurement Standards
texts.text: Section 2: Application of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2.1. Applicability of the Procurement Standards
texts.text: 2.1. Applicability of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Standards  shall  be  implemented  in  their  entirety  and  within  the  flexibility defined therein. Partial implementation of the Procurement Standards is not allowed.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Standards  shall  be  implemented  in  their  entirety  and  within  the  flexibility defined therein. Partial implementation of the Procurement Standards is not allowed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Standards  shall  be  applicable  to  the  government  entities  and  any  other organisation included through a resolution issued by the Executive Council or by any other body authorised by the Executive Council.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Standards  shall  be  applicable  to  the  government  entities  and  any  other organisation included through a resolution issued by the Executive Council or by any other body authorised by the Executive Council.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2.2. Compliance with the Procurement Standards
texts.text: 2.2. Compliance with the Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners must have knowledge and understanding of the Procurement Standards.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must have knowledge and understanding of the Procurement Standards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall ensure that Procurement Standards are communicated and made available to all the relevant stakeholders across the government entity.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  be  responsible  for  ensuring  that  the  Procurement Practitioners act in compliance with the Procurement Standards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  head  of  the  Procurement  and  the  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  sign  a  declaration undertaking the responsibility to ensure that the procurement function of the government entity operates in compliance with the Procurement Standards.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  Procurement  and  the  Procurement  Practitioners  shall  sign  a  declaration undertaking the responsibility to ensure that the procurement function of the government entity operates in compliance with the Procurement Standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2.3. Procurement Manual
texts.text: 2.3. Procurement Manual

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The government entity must implement the Procurement Manual issued pursuant to the Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards. The Executive Council or the relevant body authorised by the Executive Council may exclude any government entity from the application of the Procurement Manual.
texts.text: The government entity must implement the Procurement Manual issued pursuant to the Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards. The Executive Council or the relevant body authorised by the Executive Council may exclude any government entity from the application of the Procurement Manual.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Manual shall be consistent with the Procurement Standards and shall include the methodology and procedures of the procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement Manual shall be consistent with the Procurement Standards and shall include the methodology and procedures of the procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Manual shall be updated periodically to ensure that best practices are applied in procurement operations.
texts.text: The Procurement Manual shall be updated periodically to ensure that best practices are applied in procurement operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for ensuring that the Procurement implements the Procurement Manual.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for ensuring that the Procurement implements the Procurement Manual.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2.4. Quality Assurance
texts.text: 2.4. Quality Assurance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall prepare and maintain a quality assurance and improvement program that covers all aspects of the procurement function.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall prepare and maintain a quality assurance and improvement program that covers all aspects of the procurement function.

texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall obtain approval of the quality assurance and improvement program from the Procurement Committee.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall obtain approval of the quality assurance and improvement program from the Procurement Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The quality assurance and improvement program shall assess compliance of the procurement function with the Procurement Standards, the Procurement Manual and the Code of Business Ethics.  This  program  shall  include  an  evaluation  of  the  effectiveness  and  efficiency  of  the procurement function and the identification of opportunities for improvement.
texts.text: The quality assurance and improvement program shall assess compliance of the procurement function with the Procurement Standards, the Procurement Manual and the Code of Business Ethics.  This  program  shall  include  an  evaluation  of  the  effectiveness  and  efficiency  of  the procurement function and the identification of opportunities for improvement.

texts.text: 2.5. Interpretation of the Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Dedicated procurement professionals authorised for maintaining the Procurement Standards shall be responsible for responding to queries regarding the Procurement Standards.
texts.text: Dedicated procurement professionals authorised for maintaining the Procurement Standards shall be responsible for responding to queries regarding the Procurement Standards.

texts.orig: Enablement Standards

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Enablement Standards define the attributes of functions and individuals involved in procurement operations.  They  describe  requirements  for  actors,  relations  and  setup  conditions  required  to perform the procurement effectively.
texts.text: The Enablement Standards define the attributes of functions and individuals involved in procurement operations.  They  describe  requirements  for  actors,  relations  and  setup  conditions  required  to perform the procurement effectively.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.1. Procurement Charter
texts.text: 3.1. Procurement Charter

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Charter  defines  the  obligatory  roles  in  the  procurement  function  and mechanism of its governance in line with the Procurement Framework.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Charter  defines  the  obligatory  roles  in  the  procurement  function  and mechanism of its governance in line with the Procurement Framework.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Charter defines the committees required for the procurement operations, in particular  the  roles  and  responsibilities  of  the  Procurement  Committee  and  the  Tendering Committee.
texts.text: The Procurement Charter defines the committees required for the procurement operations, in particular  the  roles  and  responsibilities  of  the  Procurement  Committee  and  the  Tendering Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall ensure that procurement operations are in accordance with the Procurement Charter.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall ensure that procurement operations are in accordance with the Procurement Charter.

texts.orig: 3.2. Types of Procurement
texts.text: 3.2. Types of Procurement

texts.text: The Procurement is divided into the following three main types:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.3. Organisation of the Procurement Function
texts.text: 3.3. Organisation of the Procurement Function

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall execute its operations through an organisational unit led by the head of the Procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement shall execute its operations through an organisational unit led by the head of the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: This unit may be established within or outside of the government entity and shall be independent of the other units of the government entity. It shall be empowered and capable of executing the duties and responsibilities entrusted to the Procurement.
texts.text: This unit may be established within or outside of the government entity and shall be independent of the other units of the government entity. It shall be empowered and capable of executing the duties and responsibilities entrusted to the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The role of the head of the Procurement shall be assigned to an executive level position or to a position  reporting  to  an  executive  level  that  enables  the  Procurement  to  fulfil  its  assigned responsibilities.
texts.text: The role of the head of the Procurement shall be assigned to an executive level position or to a position  reporting  to  an  executive  level  that  enables  the  Procurement  to  fulfil  its  assigned responsibilities.

texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement must conduct its activities through professional staff consisting of individuals, the  Procurement  Practitioners,  possessing  academic  qualifications,  professional  certificates, practical experience and skills needed to perform assigned responsibilities.
texts.text: The Procurement must conduct its activities through professional staff consisting of individuals, the  Procurement  Practitioners,  possessing  academic  qualifications,  professional  certificates, practical experience and skills needed to perform assigned responsibilities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.4. Information Technology Platform and Master Data
texts.text: 3.4. Information Technology Platform and Master Data

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Procurement shall:
texts.text: The Procurement shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Utilise an information technology platform for the procurement operations, the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: A1. Utilise an information technology platform for the procurement operations, the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Manage access of the Procurement Practitioners, other relevant employees and external parties to the Procurement Gate and granting required authorizations.
texts.text: A2. Manage access of the Procurement Practitioners, other relevant employees and external parties to the Procurement Gate and granting required authorizations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Manage the Category Hierarchy for goods, services and projects, which shall serve as a primary structure for planning, execution and reporting.
texts.text: A3. Manage the Category Hierarchy for goods, services and projects, which shall serve as a primary structure for planning, execution and reporting.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.5. Roles of the Procurement Practitioners
texts.text: 3.5. Roles of the Procurement Practitioners

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement of each government entity shall identify and document the roles and  duties  of  the  Procurement  Practitioners  ensuring  compliance  with  the  Procurement Standards.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement of each government entity shall identify and document the roles and  duties  of  the  Procurement  Practitioners  ensuring  compliance  with  the  Procurement Standards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The roles must be created in alignment with the strategic, tactical and operational processes defined by the Execution Standards.
texts.text: The roles must be created in alignment with the strategic, tactical and operational processes defined by the Execution Standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.6. Procurement Internal Controls
texts.text: 3.6. Procurement Internal Controls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall act in line with the internal controls implementing segregation of duties to prevent frauds and errors. No one individual shall control consecutive stages of the requisition to payment cycle. There shall be segregation of duties between the requisitioning, contracting and  ordering,  receiving  and  paying.  If  separation  at  the  level  of  roles  is  not  possible  then separation must be maintained at the individual level. The individual separation requires the approval of any performed activity by another individual.
texts.text: The Procurement shall act in line with the internal controls implementing segregation of duties to prevent frauds and errors. No one individual shall control consecutive stages of the requisition to payment cycle. There shall be segregation of duties between the requisitioning, contracting and  ordering,  receiving  and  paying.  If  separation  at  the  level  of  roles  is  not  possible  then separation must be maintained at the individual level. The individual separation requires the approval of any performed activity by another individual.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Segregation of duties requires separation of requestors or receivers and accounts personnel, as well as separation of requestors and approvers.
texts.text: Segregation of duties requires separation of requestors or receivers and accounts personnel, as well as separation of requestors and approvers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall maintain an electronic audit trail documenting the segregation of duties for each sourcing event and each transaction.
texts.text: The Procurement shall maintain an electronic audit trail documenting the segregation of duties for each sourcing event and each transaction.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.7. Procurement Delegation of Authority
texts.text: 3.7. Procurement Delegation of Authority

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Delegation of Authority, the PDoA, shall describe division of authority and powers in the government entity related to procurement operations.
texts.text: The Procurement Delegation of Authority, the PDoA, shall describe division of authority and powers in the government entity related to procurement operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The PDoA must contain all the financial and non-financial authorisers related to all procurement activities.
texts.text: The PDoA must contain all the financial and non-financial authorisers related to all procurement activities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 4: Procurement Clients and Partners
texts.text: Section 4: Procurement Clients and Partners

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4.1. Coordination with the requesting party
texts.text: 4.1. Coordination with the requesting party

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall undertake actions to facilitate collaboration and coordination with the requesting party, from now on referred to as the End-users, to ensure the requirements are understood and fulfilled.
texts.text: The Procurement shall undertake actions to facilitate collaboration and coordination with the requesting party, from now on referred to as the End-users, to ensure the requirements are understood and fulfilled.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4.2. Coordination with the Finance and the Legal
texts.text: 4.2. Coordination with the Finance and the Legal

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall closely coordinate with the Finance and the Legal functions within the government entity. It shall manage the mutual relationship between the functions and shall take the necessary advice from these functions.
texts.text: The Procurement shall closely coordinate with the Finance and the Legal functions within the government entity. It shall manage the mutual relationship between the functions and shall take the necessary advice from these functions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4.3. Coordination with Suppliers and Other Relevant Parties
texts.text: 4.3. Coordination with Suppliers and Other Relevant Parties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall manage its relations with Suppliers and other relevant parties through specific procedures, in line with the Procurement Standards and the Procurement Manual.
texts.text: The Procurement shall manage its relations with Suppliers and other relevant parties through specific procedures, in line with the Procurement Standards and the Procurement Manual.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4.4. Procurement Risks Management
texts.text: 4.4. Procurement Risks Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall prepare a register to document the procurement risks according to the best  standards  and  methodologies  for  risk  management,  with  the  objective  of  identifying, evaluating and mitigating the risks.
texts.text: The Procurement shall prepare a register to document the procurement risks according to the best  standards  and  methodologies  for  risk  management,  with  the  objective  of  identifying, evaluating and mitigating the risks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  view  risk  management  as  an  embedded  activity  throughout  all procurement  operations.  Procurement  risks  are  defined  as  all  potential  events  that  can negatively affect the operations of the procurement function.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  view  risk  management  as  an  embedded  activity  throughout  all procurement  operations.  Procurement  risks  are  defined  as  all  potential  events  that  can negatively affect the operations of the procurement function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall apply common criteria and approach for risk management intended to identify,  evaluate,  mitigate,  monitor  and  communicate  risks  related  to  the  procurement operations across the government entity.
texts.text: The Procurement shall apply common criteria and approach for risk management intended to identify,  evaluate,  mitigate,  monitor  and  communicate  risks  related  to  the  procurement operations across the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall take into consideration every-day and exceptional risks that may affect the procurement operations.
texts.text: The Procurement shall take into consideration every-day and exceptional risks that may affect the procurement operations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4.5. Procedures for Compliance with Appicable Legislations
texts.text: 4.5. Procedures for Compliance with Appicable Legislations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners must be familiar and act in line with the legislations applicable for the Procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners must be familiar and act in line with the legislations applicable for the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  head  of  the  Procurement  in  coordination  with  the  Legal  shall  establish  mechanisms  to ensure  the  Procurement  operates  in  compliance  with  the  Procurement  Standards,  the Procurement Manual and the applicable legislations.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  Procurement  in  coordination  with  the  Legal  shall  establish  mechanisms  to ensure  the  Procurement  operates  in  compliance  with  the  Procurement  Standards,  the Procurement Manual and the applicable legislations.

texts.orig: Section 5: Procurement Governance and Communication
texts.text: Section 5: Procurement Governance and Communication

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5.1. The Procurement Committee
texts.text: 5.1. The Procurement Committee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A single Procurement Committee shall be established at each government entity to manage the scope of the Procurement and supervise its operations.
texts.text: A single Procurement Committee shall be established at each government entity to manage the scope of the Procurement and supervise its operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Chairman  of  the  government  entity  shall  appoint  the  members  of  the  Procurement Committee.
texts.text: The  Chairman  of  the  government  entity  shall  appoint  the  members  of  the  Procurement Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Committee  shall  supervise  procurement  operations  and  endorse  relevant procurement activities as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Committee  shall  supervise  procurement  operations  and  endorse  relevant procurement activities as per the PDoA.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5.2. The Tendering Committees
texts.text: 5.2. The Tendering Committees

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Tendering  Committees  shall  be  established  to  evaluate  the  results  of  relevant  tenders  and encourage cross-functional collaboration.
texts.text: Tendering  Committees  shall  be  established  to  evaluate  the  results  of  relevant  tenders  and encourage cross-functional collaboration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Separate Tendering Committees for technical and commercial evaluations may be formed, as required.
texts.text: Separate Tendering Committees for technical and commercial evaluations may be formed, as required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  endorse  the  members  of  the  Tendering  Committees appointed by authorised parties as per the PDoA for each relevant tender.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  endorse  the  members  of  the  Tendering  Committees appointed by authorised parties as per the PDoA for each relevant tender.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5.3. Redressal Authority for Procurement
texts.text: 5.3. Redressal Authority for Procurement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall adhere to the internal reporting structure for the redressal of any internal grievances or complaints related to the operations of the Procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement shall adhere to the internal reporting structure for the redressal of any internal grievances or complaints related to the operations of the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall escalate unresolved grievances or complaints raised by the Suppliers to the authorised committees or bodies established for this purpose.
texts.text: The Procurement shall escalate unresolved grievances or complaints raised by the Suppliers to the authorised committees or bodies established for this purpose.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5.4. Communication Channels
texts.text: 5.4. Communication Channels

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall establish suitable communication channels to facilitate communication and coordination between all parties involved in the execution of the procurement operations.
texts.text: The Procurement shall establish suitable communication channels to facilitate communication and coordination between all parties involved in the execution of the procurement operations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 8: Procurement Strategy
texts.text: Section 8: Procurement Strategy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 8.1. Introduction
texts.text: 8.1. Introduction

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The strategy of the Procurement is integral to achieving the overall strategy of the government entity.  To  that  end,  written  procurement  strategy,  which  may  be  part  of  the  broader organisational strategy of the government entity, shall be created by the Procurement.
texts.text: The strategy of the Procurement is integral to achieving the overall strategy of the government entity.  To  that  end,  written  procurement  strategy,  which  may  be  part  of  the  broader organisational strategy of the government entity, shall be created by the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The procurement strategy shall include the following:
texts.text: The procurement strategy shall include the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Vision, mission and strategic objectives for the Procurement
texts.text: B1. Vision, mission and strategic objectives for the Procurement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Procurement categories with their high-level strategies
texts.text: B2. Procurement categories with their high-level strategies

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Demand management insights, targets and actions
texts.text: B3. Demand management insights, targets and actions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Supply options with impact and risk assessment
texts.text: B4. Supply options with impact and risk assessment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B5. The potential for rationalisation, standardisation, and economies of scale
texts.text: B5. The potential for rationalisation, standardisation, and economies of scale

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B6. Completed, ongoing and planned strategic actions
texts.text: B6. Completed, ongoing and planned strategic actions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B7. Development and management of the relationship with key stakeholders
texts.text: B7. Development and management of the relationship with key stakeholders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  procurement  strategy  shall  be  prepared  by  the  head  of  the  Procurement  and  shall  be submitted for approval of the Procurement Committee, which is followed by the approval of the Chairman of the government entity.
texts.text: The  procurement  strategy  shall  be  prepared  by  the  head  of  the  Procurement  and  shall  be submitted for approval of the Procurement Committee, which is followed by the approval of the Chairman of the government entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 8.2. Vision and Mission
texts.text: 8.2. Vision and Mission

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  vision  and  mission  of  the  Procurement  shall  extend  from  the  vision  and  mission  of  the government entity.  They  shall  be  in  line  with  the  Core  Principles  and  constitute  part  of  the procurement strategy.
texts.text: The  vision  and  mission  of  the  Procurement  shall  extend  from  the  vision  and  mission  of  the government entity.  They  shall  be  in  line  with  the  Core  Principles  and  constitute  part  of  the procurement strategy.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 8.3. Strategic Goals and Objectives
texts.text: 8.3. Strategic Goals and Objectives

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall set strategic goals and objectives based on the vision and mission. The goals describe what will happen and objectives describe what will be achieved.
texts.text: The Procurement shall set strategic goals and objectives based on the vision and mission. The goals describe what will happen and objectives describe what will be achieved.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall cascade down the objectives and goals agreed collaboratively with the End-users and the Finance. The Procurement shall set key performance indicators that will be used to report fulfilment of the procurement strategy.
texts.text: The Procurement shall cascade down the objectives and goals agreed collaboratively with the End-users and the Finance. The Procurement shall set key performance indicators that will be used to report fulfilment of the procurement strategy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  all  stakeholders  in  the  government  entity, including the Procurement Practitioners, are aware of the strategic goals and objectives.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  all  stakeholders  in  the  government  entity, including the Procurement Practitioners, are aware of the strategic goals and objectives.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  assign  performance  objectives  to  the  Procurement Practitioners in line with the strategic goals of the procurement function. These objectives shall be used to assess the performance of the Procurement Practitioners.
texts.text: The  head  of  the  Procurement  shall  assign  performance  objectives  to  the  Procurement Practitioners in line with the strategic goals of the procurement function. These objectives shall be used to assess the performance of the Procurement Practitioners.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Strategic goals and objectives of procurement strategy shall relate, but are not limited to:
texts.text: The Strategic goals and objectives of procurement strategy shall relate, but are not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E1. Capabilities, processes and organisation of the Procurement
texts.text: E1. Capabilities, processes and organisation of the Procurement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E2. Planned delivery of the procurement services including ongoing and upcoming projects and contracts in place as well as planned
texts.text: E2. Planned delivery of the procurement services including ongoing and upcoming projects and contracts in place as well as planned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E3. Category management with approach, structure, and content of the actual strategies
texts.text: E3. Category management with approach, structure, and content of the actual strategies

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E4. Sourcing management as execution part of the category strategies and ad-hoc requests
texts.text: E4. Sourcing management as execution part of the category strategies and ad-hoc requests

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E5. Contract management and Supplier management following the results of the sourcing
texts.text: E5. Contract management and Supplier management following the results of the sourcing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E6. Requisition to pay operations
texts.text: E6. Requisition to pay operations

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 8.4. Implementation of the Procurement Strategy
texts.text: 8.4. Implementation of the Procurement Strategy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall plan the implementation of the procurement strategy consisting of the initiatives approved by the Procurement Committee.
texts.text: The Procurement shall plan the implementation of the procurement strategy consisting of the initiatives approved by the Procurement Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall identify and prioritise potential initiatives based on internal and external analysis. The Procurement is encouraged to seek inputs from the End-users acting as subject matter experts.
texts.text: The Procurement shall identify and prioritise potential initiatives based on internal and external analysis. The Procurement is encouraged to seek inputs from the End-users acting as subject matter experts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Appropriate  business  cases  shall  be  prepared  by  the  Procurement  for  the  initiatives.  The execution of the initiatives shall be planned against an annual calendar. The business case must be created for initiatives related to the procurement of projects.
texts.text: Appropriate  business  cases  shall  be  prepared  by  the  Procurement  for  the  initiatives.  The execution of the initiatives shall be planned against an annual calendar. The business case must be created for initiatives related to the procurement of projects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall continuously track the execution of procurement strategy and present it to the involved parties.
texts.text: The Procurement shall continuously track the execution of procurement strategy and present it to the involved parties.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 9: Demand and Category Management
texts.text: Section 9: Demand and Category Management

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.1. Introduction
texts.text: 9.1. Introduction

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  drive  the  demand  and  category  management  to  have  a  clear understanding of the demand and ensure the right supply of goods, services and projects so that the government entity achieves its objectives.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  drive  the  demand  and  category  management  to  have  a  clear understanding of the demand and ensure the right supply of goods, services and projects so that the government entity achieves its objectives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Demand management involves developing forward-looking estimates of  the required goods, services and projects by having a clear understanding of specifications, quantities, timelines and importance. It drives cost efficiencies through challenging and consolidation of requirements of End-users to standardise purchases, eradicate wasteful practices and avoid unnecessary costs.
texts.text: Demand management involves developing forward-looking estimates of  the required goods, services and projects by having a clear understanding of specifications, quantities, timelines and importance. It drives cost efficiencies through challenging and consolidation of requirements of End-users to standardise purchases, eradicate wasteful practices and avoid unnecessary costs.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Category management is a structured approach, which aims at developing plans and strategies to  deliver  value  for  a  specific  category  of  spend.  It  takes  into  account  internal  and  external environments for reducing procurement costs, driving innovation and mitigating risks.
texts.text: Category management is a structured approach, which aims at developing plans and strategies to  deliver  value  for  a  specific  category  of  spend.  It  takes  into  account  internal  and  external environments for reducing procurement costs, driving innovation and mitigating risks.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.2. Category Analysis
texts.text: 9.2. Category Analysis

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  managing  categories  shall  perform  detailed analysis  of  categories  focusing  on  internal  and  external  factors  to  identify  opportunities  for driving savings and efficiencies.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  managing  categories  shall  perform  detailed analysis  of  categories  focusing  on  internal  and  external  factors  to  identify  opportunities  for driving savings and efficiencies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  internal category profiles shall at the minimum include the following elements:
texts.text: The  internal category profiles shall at the minimum include the following elements:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Description of the category with its scope and use
texts.text: B1. Description of the category with its scope and use

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Spend profile showing the distribution of spend, Suppliers, and contracts
texts.text: B2. Spend profile showing the distribution of spend, Suppliers, and contracts

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Demand profile outlining current and estimated business needs
texts.text: B3. Demand profile outlining current and estimated business needs

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Stakeholders profiles relevant for the category
texts.text: B4. Stakeholders profiles relevant for the category

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  external  category  profiles  based  on  market  analysis  shall  at  the  minimum  include  the following elements:
texts.text: The  external  category  profiles  based  on  market  analysis  shall  at  the  minimum  include  the following elements:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C1. Industry Structure and its added value chain
texts.text: C1. Industry Structure and its added value chain

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C2. Market  structure  and  trends  including  size,  business  segments,  prices  and  commodity indices
texts.text: C2. Market  structure  and  trends  including  size,  business  segments,  prices  and  commodity indices

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C3. Analysis of Economic Factors which drive the demand
texts.text: C3. Analysis of Economic Factors which drive the demand

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C4. Analysis of total cost and cost drivers of the category
texts.text: C4. Analysis of total cost and cost drivers of the category

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C5. Supplier landscape including the number, composition and standing of the major Suppliers
texts.text: C5. Supplier landscape including the number, composition and standing of the major Suppliers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C6. Analysis of forces that determine the competitiveness of the industry
texts.text: C6. Analysis of forces that determine the competitiveness of the industry

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.3 Category Strategy
texts.text: 9.3 Category Strategy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall utilise the results of category analysis to develop strategies, which set an overall direction for the management of categories through initiatives.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall utilise the results of category analysis to develop strategies, which set an overall direction for the management of categories through initiatives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners may seek cross-functional inputs for developing the category strategy, if required.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners may seek cross-functional inputs for developing the category strategy, if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The category strategy must identify value levers that reduce procurement costs, drive innovation and efficiency while mitigating risks associated with the category.
texts.text: The category strategy must identify value levers that reduce procurement costs, drive innovation and efficiency while mitigating risks associated with the category.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall prepare category segmentation as a part of the overall category strategy. The category segmentation shall consider at a minimum the following:
texts.text: The Procurement shall prepare category segmentation as a part of the overall category strategy. The category segmentation shall consider at a minimum the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C1. Criticality of category for the government entity
texts.text: C1. Criticality of category for the government entity

texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C2. Ease of supply of goods, services and projects including Supplier substitution
texts.text: C2. Ease of supply of goods, services and projects including Supplier substitution

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C3. Potential benefits to be realised
texts.text: C3. Potential benefits to be realised

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.4. Intellectual Property
texts.text: 9.4. Intellectual Property

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall collaborate with the End-users to identify if the required goods, services or  projects  involve  Intellectual  Property,  including  Background  Intellectual  Property  and Foreground Intellectual Property.
texts.text: The Procurement shall collaborate with the End-users to identify if the required goods, services or  projects  involve  Intellectual  Property,  including  Background  Intellectual  Property  and Foreground Intellectual Property.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users justify any requests to transfer, license, retain or share the ownership of Intellectual Property not owned by the government entity, such a request may be supported by a business case developed by the End-users.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users justify any requests to transfer, license, retain or share the ownership of Intellectual Property not owned by the government entity, such a request may be supported by a business case developed by the End-users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  consult  with  the  Legal  and  the  End-users  to  ensure  that  relevant provisions are included in the solicitation and contract documents and communicated to the Suppliers, in case the Intellectual Property not owned by the government entity is required to be transferred, licensed, retained or shared.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  consult  with  the  Legal  and  the  End-users  to  ensure  that  relevant provisions are included in the solicitation and contract documents and communicated to the Suppliers, in case the Intellectual Property not owned by the government entity is required to be transferred, licensed, retained or shared.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall consult with the Legal and the End-users to ensure that the Intellectual Property  owned  by  the  government  entity  is  protected  through  relevant  provisions  in  the solicitation and contract documents.
texts.text: The Procurement shall consult with the Legal and the End-users to ensure that the Intellectual Property  owned  by  the  government  entity  is  protected  through  relevant  provisions  in  the solicitation and contract documents.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.5. Consolidated Annual Demand
texts.text: 9.5. Consolidated Annual Demand

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall initiate and drive the annual demand consolidation for the fiscal year to ensure that the government entity operates normally and continuously. The Procurement shall collect from the End-users the best estimates of annual requirements for goods, services and projects. The information collected must, at the minimum, include:
texts.text: The Procurement shall initiate and drive the annual demand consolidation for the fiscal year to ensure that the government entity operates normally and continuously. The Procurement shall collect from the End-users the best estimates of annual requirements for goods, services and projects. The information collected must, at the minimum, include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Identification of requirements against the Category Hierarchy and their specifications
texts.text: A1. Identification of requirements against the Category Hierarchy and their specifications

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Estimated quantity and expected budget for the goods, services and projects planned
texts.text: A2. Estimated quantity and expected budget for the goods, services and projects planned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Procurement timelines with expected delivery dates for goods and schedules for services and projects
texts.text: A3. Procurement timelines with expected delivery dates for goods and schedules for services and projects

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Specific demand for the procurement of projects indicating plan, the scope of work and potential Suppliers for each planned project
texts.text: A4. Specific demand for the procurement of projects indicating plan, the scope of work and potential Suppliers for each planned project

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: If  the  complete  demand  cannot  be  obtained,  then  the  Procurement  shall  estimate  the requirements.
texts.text: If  the  complete  demand  cannot  be  obtained,  then  the  Procurement  shall  estimate  the requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall seek advice from the End-users in estimating budgets for the demand based on the historical data, prices, and market insights.
texts.text: The Procurement shall seek advice from the End-users in estimating budgets for the demand based on the historical data, prices, and market insights.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  schedule  for  demand  planning  shall  be  defined  through  the  budgeting  cycle,  and  the Procurement shall communicate to the End-users the consolidated annual demand.
texts.text: The  schedule  for  demand  planning  shall  be  defined  through  the  budgeting  cycle,  and  the Procurement shall communicate to the End-users the consolidated annual demand.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for the demand consolidation activity and its results.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for the demand consolidation activity and its results.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.6. Demand Optimisation
texts.text: 9.6. Demand Optimisation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall validate the consolidated demand against historical demand trends to verify the submitted estimates. The Procurement shall investigate any abnormalities found in the estimated demand with the End-users and suggest revisions as necessary.
texts.text: The Procurement shall validate the consolidated demand against historical demand trends to verify the submitted estimates. The Procurement shall investigate any abnormalities found in the estimated demand with the End-users and suggest revisions as necessary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  verify  demand  raised  by  the  End-users  to  ensure  consumption  and purchasing  are  at  optimal  levels.  To  achieve  it  any  wasteful  practices  identified  shall  be eradicated by applying levers including, but not limited to:
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  verify  demand  raised  by  the  End-users  to  ensure  consumption  and purchasing  are  at  optimal  levels.  To  achieve  it  any  wasteful  practices  identified  shall  be eradicated by applying levers including, but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Historical consumption trend comparison
texts.text: B1. Historical consumption trend comparison

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Order quantity optimisation
texts.text: B2. Order quantity optimisation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Appropriate substitutes introduction
texts.text: B3. Appropriate substitutes introduction

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Requirements standardisation
texts.text: B4. Requirements standardisation

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.7. Fesibility Study
texts.text: 9.7. Fesibility Study

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  requestors  prepare  feasibility  study  for  purchases  of  goods, services  and  projects  requiring  justification  as  per  the  PDoA.  In  case  of  the  procurement  of projects,  the  feasibility  study  created  during  the  investment  planning  shall  be  verified  and appropriated.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  requestors  prepare  feasibility  study  for  purchases  of  goods, services  and  projects  requiring  justification  as  per  the  PDoA.  In  case  of  the  procurement  of projects,  the  feasibility  study  created  during  the  investment  planning  shall  be  verified  and appropriated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Where possible, the Procurement shall ensure that the feasibility study explore opportunities for cross-organisational collaboration within the government entity.
texts.text: Where possible, the Procurement shall ensure that the feasibility study explore opportunities for cross-organisational collaboration within the government entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.8. Procurement Financial Bridging
texts.text: 9.8. Procurement Financial Bridging

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  develop  consolidated  demand  requirements  plan  estimated  for  the categories. It shall represent mid-term spend plan used to feed financial budgeting activity.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  develop  consolidated  demand  requirements  plan  estimated  for  the categories. It shall represent mid-term spend plan used to feed financial budgeting activity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall verify and ensure the allocation of sufficient budgets for the procurement categories.
texts.text: The Procurement shall verify and ensure the allocation of sufficient budgets for the procurement categories.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The budgets shall include split between operational and capital expenditures. The Procurement shall include the budgets of planned projects separately.
texts.text: The budgets shall include split between operational and capital expenditures. The Procurement shall include the budgets of planned projects separately.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: During the execution, in case of a budget shortfall, the Procurement shall ensure that the Endusers either reduce the demand or work with the Finance to increase the allocated budget. The budgets  for  the  procurement  of  projects  shall  be  matched  against  investment  plans  of  the projects with any discrepancies raised to the respective End-user of the projects and the Finance.
texts.text: During the execution, in case of a budget shortfall, the Procurement shall ensure that the Endusers either reduce the demand or work with the Finance to increase the allocated budget. The budgets  for  the  procurement  of  projects  shall  be  matched  against  investment  plans  of  the projects with any discrepancies raised to the respective End-user of the projects and the Finance.

texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.9. Procurement Plan
texts.text: 9.9. Procurement Plan

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Procurement planning determines how best to fulfil the requirements captured from within the government entity. Its objective is to balance supply and demand so that the government entity achieves the financial and service delivery objectives.
texts.text: Procurement planning determines how best to fulfil the requirements captured from within the government entity. Its objective is to balance supply and demand so that the government entity achieves the financial and service delivery objectives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  procurement  plan  focuses  on  the  examination  of  operating  contracts  and  selection  of sourcing methods to renew existing or creating new supply agreements.
texts.text: The  procurement  plan  focuses  on  the  examination  of  operating  contracts  and  selection  of sourcing methods to renew existing or creating new supply agreements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The procurement plan defines all requirements for goods, services and projects to be procured over  a  period  of  time.  It  establishes  the  high-level  timelines  for  the  sourcing  events.  The Procurement shall use the procurement plan to consolidate similar requirements under same contracts.
texts.text: The procurement plan defines all requirements for goods, services and projects to be procured over  a  period  of  time.  It  establishes  the  high-level  timelines  for  the  sourcing  events.  The Procurement shall use the procurement plan to consolidate similar requirements under same contracts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall at the minimum consider the following parameters while preparing the procurement plan:
texts.text: The Procurement shall at the minimum consider the following parameters while preparing the procurement plan:

texts.text: D1. Needs and requirements

texts.text: D2. Quantities and estimated costs

texts.label: list_item
