texts.text: D3. Budget requirements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D4. Opportunities for demand consolidation
texts.text: D4. Opportunities for demand consolidation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D5. Appropriate procurement methods and processes
texts.text: D5. Appropriate procurement methods and processes

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D6. Schedule of sourcing events
texts.text: D6. Schedule of sourcing events

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D7. Readiness and potential risk mitigation
texts.text: D7. Readiness and potential risk mitigation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement may include in the procurement plan initiatives other than sourcing events, related to demand  management,  supplier relationship management,  contract lifecycle management and other procurement responsibilities.
texts.text: The Procurement may include in the procurement plan initiatives other than sourcing events, related to demand  management,  supplier relationship management,  contract lifecycle management and other procurement responsibilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners shall include in the procurement plan the schedule of sourcing events for their owned categories, having at a minimum the timelines of planned activities and the involved parties.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall include in the procurement plan the schedule of sourcing events for their owned categories, having at a minimum the timelines of planned activities and the involved parties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners shall prepare the procurement plans for their owned categories.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall prepare the procurement plans for their owned categories.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for approving the procurement plan.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for approving the procurement plan.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.10. Procurement Plan Monitoring
texts.text: 9.10. Procurement Plan Monitoring

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall monitor the execution of the procurement plan and if relevant adjust it to  accommodate  new  requirements  or  changes  communicated  by  and  agreed  with  the stakeholders.
texts.text: The Procurement shall monitor the execution of the procurement plan and if relevant adjust it to  accommodate  new  requirements  or  changes  communicated  by  and  agreed  with  the stakeholders.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for approving the changes to the procurement plan.
texts.text: The head of the Procurement shall be responsible for approving the changes to the procurement plan.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.11. Stakeholder Collaboration
texts.text: 9.11. Stakeholder Collaboration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  identify  key  stakeholders  involved  in  procurement  operations,  their interests  and  relative  importance.  Internal  and  external  stakeholders  can  include  partners, Suppliers, the End-users, management, the Finance, the Legal and subject matter experts.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  identify  key  stakeholders  involved  in  procurement  operations,  their interests  and  relative  importance.  Internal  and  external  stakeholders  can  include  partners, Suppliers, the End-users, management, the Finance, the Legal and subject matter experts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  identify  stakeholders  required  for  successful  procurement  planning, along with their expected contribution. The procurement planning, especially any exchange of information and correspondence with the stakeholders, shall be documented for traceability and probity.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  identify  stakeholders  required  for  successful  procurement  planning, along with their expected contribution. The procurement planning, especially any exchange of information and correspondence with the stakeholders, shall be documented for traceability and probity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9.12. Benefits Tracking
texts.text: 9.12. Benefits Tracking

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  track  the  benefits  delivered  to  the  government  entity  through  cost reduction, cost avoidance, service level and quality.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  track  the  benefits  delivered  to  the  government  entity  through  cost reduction, cost avoidance, service level and quality.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  develop  appropriate  and  consistent  methodologies  to  calculate  the benefits delivered.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  develop  appropriate  and  consistent  methodologies  to  calculate  the benefits delivered.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall develop credible baselines to measure benefits considering at a minimum the following:
texts.text: The Procurement shall develop credible baselines to measure benefits considering at a minimum the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C1. Historical costs
texts.text: C1. Historical costs

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C2. Previously contracted rates
texts.text: C2. Previously contracted rates

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C3. Budget estimates or allocation
texts.text: C3. Budget estimates or allocation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C4. Projected cost increase resulting from macroeconomic factors or Supplier requests
texts.text: C4. Projected cost increase resulting from macroeconomic factors or Supplier requests

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall collaborate with the End-users for inputs required to track the benefits and may engage the Finance and subject matter experts for validation.
texts.text: The Procurement shall collaborate with the End-users for inputs required to track the benefits and may engage the Finance and subject matter experts for validation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall regularly report the benefits.
texts.text: The Procurement shall regularly report the benefits.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 10: Source to Contract
texts.text: Section 10: Source to Contract

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.1. Introduction
texts.text: 10.1. Introduction

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement through the source to contract shall identify the right Suppliers to fulfil the government  entity's  requirements  for  goods,  services  and  projects  efficiently  and  costeffectively. The Procurement shall manage the source to contract cycle ensuring collaboration of the End-users, the Finance and the Legal, and engaging Suppliers when necessary.
texts.text: The Procurement through the source to contract shall identify the right Suppliers to fulfil the government  entity's  requirements  for  goods,  services  and  projects  efficiently  and  costeffectively. The Procurement shall manage the source to contract cycle ensuring collaboration of the End-users, the Finance and the Legal, and engaging Suppliers when necessary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The course of the source to contract cycle includes gathering specifications and requirements, identification  of  appropriate  sourcing  methods,  preparation  of  solicitation  documents  and execution of solicitation. The Procurement shall ensure evaluation of offers received, conduct negotiations and award contracts to the most suitable Suppliers.
texts.text: The course of the source to contract cycle includes gathering specifications and requirements, identification  of  appropriate  sourcing  methods,  preparation  of  solicitation  documents  and execution of solicitation. The Procurement shall ensure evaluation of offers received, conduct negotiations and award contracts to the most suitable Suppliers.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.2. General Guidance for Source to Contract
texts.text: 10.2. General Guidance for Source to Contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall adhere, at the minimum, to the following during source to contract:
texts.text: The Procurement shall adhere, at the minimum, to the following during source to contract:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Sourcing activity shall comply with the Procurement Standards, relevant regulations, and shall be performed within the confines of the Code of Business Ethics.
texts.text: A1. Sourcing activity shall comply with the Procurement Standards, relevant regulations, and shall be performed within the confines of the Code of Business Ethics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Sourcing  requests  shall  be  verified  by  the  Procurement  against  existing  contracts  and inventories to identify if the requirement can be fulfilled without entering new obligations.
texts.text: A2. Sourcing  requests  shall  be  verified  by  the  Procurement  against  existing  contracts  and inventories to identify if the requirement can be fulfilled without entering new obligations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Procurement requirement shall not be split to bypass approval authorities. If there is a genuine  need  to  split  the  procurement  requirement,  then  it  shall  be  documented  and approved by the head of the Procurement.
texts.text: A3. Procurement requirement shall not be split to bypass approval authorities. If there is a genuine  need  to  split  the  procurement  requirement,  then  it  shall  be  documented  and approved by the head of the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Sourcing for projects shall be initiated after the underlying initiative has been approved and shall require approval from appropriate authorities as per the PDoA.
texts.text: A4. Sourcing for projects shall be initiated after the underlying initiative has been approved and shall require approval from appropriate authorities as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Appropriate sourcing method and solicitation channel shall be selected by Procurement.
texts.text: A5. Appropriate sourcing method and solicitation channel shall be selected by Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Sourcing shall require approval from and shall be governed by the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: A6. Sourcing shall require approval from and shall be governed by the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A7. The Tendering Committee, if mandated by the PDoA, shall be set up for sourcing including the representatives of the requestor as well as subject matter experts relevant for the domain of the request.
texts.text: A7. The Tendering Committee, if mandated by the PDoA, shall be set up for sourcing including the representatives of the requestor as well as subject matter experts relevant for the domain of the request.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A8. The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall drive the source to contract activities for that category.
texts.text: A8. The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall drive the source to contract activities for that category.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A9. Sourcing shall be executed electronically through the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: A9. Sourcing shall be executed electronically through the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A10. Confidentiality agreement shall be signed by all Suppliers, before sharing any confidential information.
texts.text: A10. Confidentiality agreement shall be signed by all Suppliers, before sharing any confidential information.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A11. Suppliers shall be given the opportunity to raise questions and request clarifications during the sourcing activity.
texts.text: A11. Suppliers shall be given the opportunity to raise questions and request clarifications during the sourcing activity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A12. Information gathering and dissemination shall be done in an open, fair and transparent manner with all participants having equal access to information.
texts.text: A12. Information gathering and dissemination shall be done in an open, fair and transparent manner with all participants having equal access to information.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A13. Clear audit trail capturing document transmission between the Procurement and Suppliers shall be maintained electronically to facilitate tracking and auditing.
texts.text: A13. Clear audit trail capturing document transmission between the Procurement and Suppliers shall be maintained electronically to facilitate tracking and auditing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A14. Suppliers shall be given reasonable time to respond to tenders with an option to request for extensions.
texts.text: A14. Suppliers shall be given reasonable time to respond to tenders with an option to request for extensions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.3. Need Identification and Analysis
texts.text: 10.3. Need Identification and Analysis

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall initiate source to contract  cycle  when a procurement need has been identified either by the End-users or through the procurement planning exercise.
texts.text: The Procurement shall initiate source to contract  cycle  when a procurement need has been identified either by the End-users or through the procurement planning exercise.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  create  the  sourcing  request  in  the  Procurement  Gate.  The  sourcing request shall be approved by the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  create  the  sourcing  request  in  the  Procurement  Gate.  The  sourcing request shall be approved by the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  analyse  the  requirement  and  determine  whether  it  can  be  fulfilled through  an  existing  contract  or  if  there  is  a  need  for  a  new  contract.  If  the  Procurement determines that a scouring event is required to initiate a new contract, then it shall identify relevant stakeholders, determine critical business requirements and conduct internal analysis and market research to develop the sourcing strategy.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  analyse  the  requirement  and  determine  whether  it  can  be  fulfilled through  an  existing  contract  or  if  there  is  a  need  for  a  new  contract.  If  the  Procurement determines that a scouring event is required to initiate a new contract, then it shall identify relevant stakeholders, determine critical business requirements and conduct internal analysis and market research to develop the sourcing strategy.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.4. Budget Approvals and Financing
texts.text: 10.4. Budget Approvals and Financing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall partner with the End-users to develop a reliable cost estimate of the request.  The  Procurement  is  encouraged  to  use  market  research,  historical  price  trends  or budgetary quotations to develop the cost estimate.
texts.text: The Procurement shall partner with the End-users to develop a reliable cost estimate of the request.  The  Procurement  is  encouraged  to  use  market  research,  historical  price  trends  or budgetary quotations to develop the cost estimate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall determine if sufficient budget and approvals exist for the requirement. If the budget is not approved or is insufficient, then the Procurement shall ensure that the Endusers  have  the  required  budget  allocated  in  coordination  with  the  Finance  through  the appropriate process before sourcing.
texts.text: The Procurement shall determine if sufficient budget and approvals exist for the requirement. If the budget is not approved or is insufficient, then the Procurement shall ensure that the Endusers  have  the  required  budget  allocated  in  coordination  with  the  Finance  through  the appropriate process before sourcing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users allocate additional budget in coordination with the Finance before contracting, in case of shortfall.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users allocate additional budget in coordination with the Finance before contracting, in case of shortfall.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.5. Sourcing Methods
texts.text: 10.5. Sourcing Methods

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement, at the minimum, shall employ the following methods enabled through the Procurement Gate:
texts.text: The Procurement, at the minimum, shall employ the following methods enabled through the Procurement Gate:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. The Public Tender which shall be accessible through the Procurement Gate and shall be publicly  announced.  The  public  tender  shall  be  open  to  all  suppliers  allowing  them  to register in the Procurement Gate for placing the bids.
texts.text: A1. The Public Tender which shall be accessible through the Procurement Gate and shall be publicly  announced.  The  public  tender  shall  be  open  to  all  suppliers  allowing  them  to register in the Procurement Gate for placing the bids.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. The Limited Tender which shall be open to a predefined number of registered and qualified Suppliers, or the registered Suppliers recommended by the End-users and approved by the Procurement.  The  Procurement  may  include  additional  registered  Suppliers  that  are appropriate for the sourcing.
texts.text: A2. The Limited Tender which shall be open to a predefined number of registered and qualified Suppliers, or the registered Suppliers recommended by the End-users and approved by the Procurement.  The  Procurement  may  include  additional  registered  Suppliers  that  are appropriate for the sourcing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. The Sole Source Tender is a variation of the limited tender where there is only one qualified supplier capable of supplying the required goods, services and projects with whom the contract may be established.
texts.text: A3. The Sole Source Tender is a variation of the limited tender where there is only one qualified supplier capable of supplying the required goods, services and projects with whom the contract may be established.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. The  Single  Source  Tender  is  a  variation  of  the  limited  tender  where  only  one  qualified supplier is invited from a pool of registered suppliers for solicitation. This type of tendering method may be adopted when there is a valid reason for using a particular supplier. The Procurement shall endeavour to suggest suitable alternatives whenever the Single Source tender is suggested by the End-users.
texts.text: A4. The  Single  Source  Tender  is  a  variation  of  the  limited  tender  where  only  one  qualified supplier is invited from a pool of registered suppliers for solicitation. This type of tendering method may be adopted when there is a valid reason for using a particular supplier. The Procurement shall endeavour to suggest suitable alternatives whenever the Single Source tender is suggested by the End-users.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. The decision to proceed with the Sole Source or Single Source tenders shall require approval from the head of the Procurement followed by approvals defined in the PDoA.
texts.text: A5. The decision to proceed with the Sole Source or Single Source tenders shall require approval from the head of the Procurement followed by approvals defined in the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  use  appropriate  sourcing  methods  to  initiate  new  or  update  existing contracts for requested goods, services and projects.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  use  appropriate  sourcing  methods  to  initiate  new  or  update  existing contracts for requested goods, services and projects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  refer  to  the  PDoA  for  selection  and  use  of  the  appropriate  sourcing method obtaining relevant approvals.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  refer  to  the  PDoA  for  selection  and  use  of  the  appropriate  sourcing method obtaining relevant approvals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall obtain approval for Sole Source or Single Source tenders or any deviations from the prescribed sourcing methods. The Procurement shall ensure that the justification for obtaining the approval considers, at a minimum the following:
texts.text: The Procurement shall obtain approval for Sole Source or Single Source tenders or any deviations from the prescribed sourcing methods. The Procurement shall ensure that the justification for obtaining the approval considers, at a minimum the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D1. The  explanation  for  using  Sole  Source  or  Single  Source  or  deviations  from  prescribed sourcing method
texts.text: D1. The  explanation  for  using  Sole  Source  or  Single  Source  or  deviations  from  prescribed sourcing method

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D2. Business case justifying the Sole Source or Single Source tenders or benefits of deviating from prescribed sourcing method
texts.text: D2. Business case justifying the Sole Source or Single Source tenders or benefits of deviating from prescribed sourcing method

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D3. Relevant information about the requirement such as category, quantity, estimated value, source of production, approvals from concerned authorities, delivery date or schedule for goods, services and projects
texts.text: D3. Relevant information about the requirement such as category, quantity, estimated value, source of production, approvals from concerned authorities, delivery date or schedule for goods, services and projects

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall communicate lead-time for each sourcing method, so that the End-users may factor the relevant processing time in their planning.
texts.text: The Procurement shall communicate lead-time for each sourcing method, so that the End-users may factor the relevant processing time in their planning.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.6. Solicitation Channels
texts.text: 10.6. Solicitation Channels

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall select the appropriate solicitation channel for execution of the sourcing activity.  The  following  solicitation  channels,  at  the  minimum,  shall  be  available in  the Procurement Gate:
texts.text: The Procurement shall select the appropriate solicitation channel for execution of the sourcing activity.  The  following  solicitation  channels,  at  the  minimum,  shall  be  available in  the Procurement Gate:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. The  Request  for  Information,  RFI  for  short,  shall  be  used  for  gathering  information  or budget estimates from a broad base of potential Suppliers. The RFI facilitates preparation of the RFP or the RFQ, developing strategy, shortlisting Suppliers or building a database.
texts.text: A1. The  Request  for  Information,  RFI  for  short,  shall  be  used  for  gathering  information  or budget estimates from a broad base of potential Suppliers. The RFI facilitates preparation of the RFP or the RFQ, developing strategy, shortlisting Suppliers or building a database.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. The Request for Proposal, RFP for short, shall be used for seeking proposals from Suppliers. The RFP is best suited for situations where the End-users know what they want to achieve and  rely  on  Suppliers  to  propose  the  solution.  The  RFP  relies  on  the  experience  and creativity  of  Suppliers  to  define  the  best  solution  and  may  be  followed  by  the  RFQ  or negotiations.
texts.text: A2. The Request for Proposal, RFP for short, shall be used for seeking proposals from Suppliers. The RFP is best suited for situations where the End-users know what they want to achieve and  rely  on  Suppliers  to  propose  the  solution.  The  RFP  relies  on  the  experience  and creativity  of  Suppliers  to  define  the  best  solution  and  may  be  followed  by  the  RFQ  or negotiations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. The Request for Quotation, RFQ for short, shall be used for seeking pricing information for a defined scope of work or supply of specified goods or services. The specifications, terms and expectations must be defined in the RFQ.
texts.text: A3. The Request for Quotation, RFQ for short, shall be used for seeking pricing information for a defined scope of work or supply of specified goods or services. The specifications, terms and expectations must be defined in the RFQ.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. The Reverse Auction may be used as an alternative to the RFQ for highly commoditised goods, services and projects or where specifications have already been fully acknowledged by participating Suppliers. The Reverse Auction shall be conducted between a number of
texts.text: A4. The Reverse Auction may be used as an alternative to the RFQ for highly commoditised goods, services and projects or where specifications have already been fully acknowledged by participating Suppliers. The Reverse Auction shall be conducted between a number of

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: text
texts.orig: pre-selected  Suppliers  registered  for  the  category  to  help  achieve  the  savings.  The Procurement must ensure that fairness and confidentiality is maintained while conducting Reverse Auctions. Details of the participants and their offers shall not be publicly disclosed.
texts.text: pre-selected  Suppliers  registered  for  the  category  to  help  achieve  the  savings.  The Procurement must ensure that fairness and confidentiality is maintained while conducting Reverse Auctions. Details of the participants and their offers shall not be publicly disclosed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.7. Specification Engineering
texts.text: 10.7. Specification Engineering

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall develop specifications in collaboration with End-users and subject matter experts if required. The Procurement shall consider the following aspects, at the minimum, while developing specifications:
texts.text: The Procurement shall develop specifications in collaboration with End-users and subject matter experts if required. The Procurement shall consider the following aspects, at the minimum, while developing specifications:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Specifications shall define what the End-user has requested and consequently what the Supplier is expected to provide.
texts.text: A1. Specifications shall define what the End-user has requested and consequently what the Supplier is expected to provide.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Specifications  shall  ensure  all  essential  user  and  general  requirements  are  stated  in functional and performance terms.
texts.text: A2. Specifications  shall  ensure  all  essential  user  and  general  requirements  are  stated  in functional and performance terms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Specifications shall be precise yet broad enough to encourage competition.
texts.text: A3. Specifications shall be precise yet broad enough to encourage competition.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Specifications shall not favour any Supplier.
texts.text: A4. Specifications shall not favour any Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall explore the opportunity to standardise the specifications where possible.
texts.text: The Procurement shall explore the opportunity to standardise the specifications where possible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement  shall formally document  the  specifications and  inform the involved stakeholders.
texts.text: The Procurement  shall formally document  the  specifications and  inform the involved stakeholders.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.8. Sourcing Strategy
texts.text: 10.8. Sourcing Strategy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  develop  a  sourcing  strategy  for  achieving  the  objectives  set  in  the category strategy and procurement plan.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  develop  a  sourcing  strategy  for  achieving  the  objectives  set  in  the category strategy and procurement plan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  conduct  further  detailed  assessment  of  internal  trends,  market opportunities, risks and Supplier base, if not sufficiently covered in the category strategy.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  conduct  further  detailed  assessment  of  internal  trends,  market opportunities, risks and Supplier base, if not sufficiently covered in the category strategy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  select  a  sourcing  method  and  determine  the  appropriate  solicitation channel based on the objectives of sourcing activity.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  select  a  sourcing  method  and  determine  the  appropriate  solicitation channel based on the objectives of sourcing activity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The sourcing strategy shall include the expected benefits and their measurement methods.
texts.text: The sourcing strategy shall include the expected benefits and their measurement methods.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall develop a detailed plan for each sourcing events identified in the sourcing strategy having milestones, timelines and responsibilities of involved stakeholders including the End-users,  the  Tendering  Committee,  the  Procurement  Committee,  the  Finance,  the  Legal, subject matter experts and Suppliers.
texts.text: The Procurement shall develop a detailed plan for each sourcing events identified in the sourcing strategy having milestones, timelines and responsibilities of involved stakeholders including the End-users,  the  Tendering  Committee,  the  Procurement  Committee,  the  Finance,  the  Legal, subject matter experts and Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall promote cross-functional collaboration by engaging Tendering Committee for providing inputs to the sourcing strategy when mandated by the PDoA.
texts.text: The Procurement shall promote cross-functional collaboration by engaging Tendering Committee for providing inputs to the sourcing strategy when mandated by the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall obtain the approval of sourcing strategy as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The Procurement shall obtain the approval of sourcing strategy as per the PDoA.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.9. Screening of Suppliers
texts.text: 10.9. Screening of Suppliers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall establish Supplier screening criteria and screen potential Suppliers to shortlist the most competent and high-performing Suppliers. The screening criteria established by the Procurement may be based on, but not limited to:
texts.text: The Procurement shall establish Supplier screening criteria and screen potential Suppliers to shortlist the most competent and high-performing Suppliers. The screening criteria established by the Procurement may be based on, but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Financial health which includes sound financial position, audited statements of accounts, cash flow position and credit ratings
texts.text: A1. Financial health which includes sound financial position, audited statements of accounts, cash flow position and credit ratings

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Commercial standing which includes business relations with reputed organisations
texts.text: A2. Commercial standing which includes business relations with reputed organisations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Legal standing which includes information regarding past litigations, suspension of business activities, bankruptcy and liquidation
texts.text: A3. Legal standing which includes information regarding past litigations, suspension of business activities, bankruptcy and liquidation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Technical capabilities which include the provision of technical staff with required knowhow, manufacturing or service equipment, distribution nertwork and certifications related to quality, health, safety and evironment
texts.text: A4. Technical capabilities which include the provision of technical staff with required knowhow, manufacturing or service equipment, distribution nertwork and certifications related to quality, health, safety and evironment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Quality  of  the  goods,  services  and  projects  established  by  reviewing  the  successful competition of previous contracts and business performed successfully
texts.text: A5. Quality  of  the  goods,  services  and  projects  established  by  reviewing  the  successful competition of previous contracts and business performed successfully

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Historical Supplier performance assessed by evaluating the Supplier performance scores available in the Procurement Gate
texts.text: A6. Historical Supplier performance assessed by evaluating the Supplier performance scores available in the Procurement Gate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement may seek to engage diverse and underrepresented Suppliers based on the strategic goals and objectives approved by the appropriate government authority.
texts.text: The Procurement may seek to engage diverse and underrepresented Suppliers based on the strategic goals and objectives approved by the appropriate government authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  End-users  may  recommend  registered  Suppliers  for  sourcing.  The  Procurement  is encouraged to augment the list of recommended Suppliers based on the Supplier database, previous contracts and market research.
texts.text: The  End-users  may  recommend  registered  Suppliers  for  sourcing.  The  Procurement  is encouraged to augment the list of recommended Suppliers based on the Supplier database, previous contracts and market research.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: In case of the procurement of projects, the Procurement shall include any Suppliers proposed during  the  planning.  The  Supplier  screening  criteria  for  the  procurement  of  projects  may  be recommended by the End-user of the project.
texts.text: In case of the procurement of projects, the Procurement shall include any Suppliers proposed during  the  planning.  The  Supplier  screening  criteria  for  the  procurement  of  projects  may  be recommended by the End-user of the project.

texts.text: A6. Non-disclosure  agreement  and  no-conflict  of  interest  undertaking  required  of  the government entity's Suppliers

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The Procurement is encouraged to utilise the standard templates available in the Procurement Gate for solicitation.

texts.text: 10.11. Financial Instruments

texts.text: 10.12. Functional Review of Solicitation Document

texts.text: 10.13. Approval of Solicitation Document and Issuance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  obtain  approval  of  the  prepared  solicitation  documents  from  the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  obtain  approval  of  the  prepared  solicitation  documents  from  the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall issue the approved solicitation document using the Procurement Gate, and facilitate all administrative functions such as advertising, notifications, managing meetings and conferences, receiving queries and issuing clarifications.
texts.text: The Procurement shall issue the approved solicitation document using the Procurement Gate, and facilitate all administrative functions such as advertising, notifications, managing meetings and conferences, receiving queries and issuing clarifications.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.14. Solicitation Execution Considerations
texts.text: 10.14. Solicitation Execution Considerations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall drive the execution of solicitation ensuring collaboration of the End-user, the  Finance  and  the  Legal.  The  Procurement  shall  administer  the  execution  of  solicitation through the Procurement Gate, adhering at the minimum, to the following principles:
texts.text: The Procurement shall drive the execution of solicitation ensuring collaboration of the End-user, the  Finance  and  the  Legal.  The  Procurement  shall  administer  the  execution  of  solicitation through the Procurement Gate, adhering at the minimum, to the following principles:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Established procedures for Public, Limited, Sole Source and Single Source tenders shall be followed
texts.text: A1. Established procedures for Public, Limited, Sole Source and Single Source tenders shall be followed

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Solicitations  shall  be  appropriately  published  as  per  the  requirement  of  the  selected sourcing method
texts.text: A2. Solicitations  shall  be  appropriately  published  as  per  the  requirement  of  the  selected sourcing method

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Probity  and  transparency  shall  be  maintained  for  ensuring  fairness,  impartiality,  and consistency
texts.text: A3. Probity  and  transparency  shall  be  maintained  for  ensuring  fairness,  impartiality,  and consistency

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. The  same  level  of  information  shall  be  available  to  all  competing  Suppliers  and amendments in the solicitations shall be shared with all competing Suppliers at the same time
texts.text: A4. The  same  level  of  information  shall  be  available  to  all  competing  Suppliers  and amendments in the solicitations shall be shared with all competing Suppliers at the same time

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Necessary communication to and from Suppliers shall be done through the Procurement Gate
texts.text: A5. Necessary communication to and from Suppliers shall be done through the Procurement Gate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Sufficient time shall be given to Suppliers for submission of a response to the solicitation and formal written request for an extension in deadline shall be considered. Extension in deadline shall apply to all Suppliers
texts.text: A6. Sufficient time shall be given to Suppliers for submission of a response to the solicitation and formal written request for an extension in deadline shall be considered. Extension in deadline shall apply to all Suppliers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A7. Additional rounds of solicitation may be held if needed
texts.text: A7. Additional rounds of solicitation may be held if needed

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.15. Bid Management
texts.text: 10.15. Bid Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall manage bidding activity by arranging pre-bid meetings, receiving queries and  issuing  clarifications,  revising  or  cancelling  solicitations,  handling  bid  submission  and opening. The Procurement shall coordinate with involved stakeholders including the Suppliers, the End-users, the Finance, the Legal, the Procurement Committee and other parties.
texts.text: The Procurement shall manage bidding activity by arranging pre-bid meetings, receiving queries and  issuing  clarifications,  revising  or  cancelling  solicitations,  handling  bid  submission  and opening. The Procurement shall coordinate with involved stakeholders including the Suppliers, the End-users, the Finance, the Legal, the Procurement Committee and other parties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Pre-bid meetings may be organised with potential Suppliers to discuss the scope of work provisions, payment terms, technical and financial evaluation criteria and other terms and conditions. The Procurement shall not provide any information about the acceptable value of commercial offers. The Procurement is encouraged to organise pre-bid meetings for large and complex goods, services and projects.
texts.text: A1. Pre-bid meetings may be organised with potential Suppliers to discuss the scope of work provisions, payment terms, technical and financial evaluation criteria and other terms and conditions. The Procurement shall not provide any information about the acceptable value of commercial offers. The Procurement is encouraged to organise pre-bid meetings for large and complex goods, services and projects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Supplier queries regarding the solicitation shall be submitted through the Procurement Gate. The Procurement shall draft responses seeking input from the End-users or subject matter experts if required. The list of queries and clarifications shall be made available to all competing Suppliers to promote transparency and probity.
texts.text: A2. Supplier queries regarding the solicitation shall be submitted through the Procurement Gate. The Procurement shall draft responses seeking input from the End-users or subject matter experts if required. The list of queries and clarifications shall be made available to all competing Suppliers to promote transparency and probity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Amendment to the solicitation document shall be issued by the Procurement, if there is a material change in the scope of work, specifications, quantities, delivery schedules, terms and  conditions,  or  to  clarify  any  ambiguity  or  errors  in  the  solicitation  document.  The
texts.text: A3. Amendment to the solicitation document shall be issued by the Procurement, if there is a material change in the scope of work, specifications, quantities, delivery schedules, terms and  conditions,  or  to  clarify  any  ambiguity  or  errors  in  the  solicitation  document.  The

The Procurement  shall  ensure  that  amendment  to  solicitation  has  a  valid  and  approved business justification.
texts.text: amendment shall be issued immediately to all competing Suppliers, and bid submission date shall be suitably revised to give appropriate time for the submission of responses. The Procurement  shall  ensure  that  amendment  to  solicitation  has  a  valid  and  approved business justification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Solicitation cancellation shall be made by the Procurement, if there are substantial changes in the procurement requirement or if a duly approved request for cancellation is submitted by  the  End-users.  The  Procurement  may  also  cancel  solicitation  if  requirements  of competitive bidding are not met.
texts.text: A4. Solicitation cancellation shall be made by the Procurement, if there are substantial changes in the procurement requirement or if a duly approved request for cancellation is submitted by  the  End-users.  The  Procurement  may  also  cancel  solicitation  if  requirements  of competitive bidding are not met.

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Bid  submission  shall  be  through  the  Procurement  Gate  and  shall  be  facilitated  by  the Procurement. Bid proposals shall be date and time stamped in the Procurement Gate, and late bids shall not be accepted.
texts.text: A6. Bid  submission  shall  be  through  the  Procurement  Gate  and  shall  be  facilitated  by  the Procurement. Bid proposals shall be date and time stamped in the Procurement Gate, and late bids shall not be accepted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A7. Bid opening shall be organised by the Procurement electronically. The obtained proposals of  competing  Suppliers  shall  be  disclosed  only  to  the  Tendering  Committee  and  the Procurement.
texts.text: A7. Bid opening shall be organised by the Procurement electronically. The obtained proposals of  competing  Suppliers  shall  be  disclosed  only  to  the  Tendering  Committee  and  the Procurement.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.16. Rejection of Bids
texts.text: 10.16. Rejection of Bids

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  verify  whether  the  submitted  bids  are  responsive.  Bids  shall  be considered  responsive  when  submitted  on  time  and  conform  to  the  requirements  and specifications of the solicitation.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  verify  whether  the  submitted  bids  are  responsive.  Bids  shall  be considered  responsive  when  submitted  on  time  and  conform  to  the  requirements  and specifications of the solicitation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall reject the bids which do not comply with the provisions defined in the solicitation document or are in breach of the requirements.
texts.text: The Procurement shall reject the bids which do not comply with the provisions defined in the solicitation document or are in breach of the requirements.

texts.text: 10.17. Technical Evaluation

texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that assigned individuals or the Tendering Committees perform the technical evaluation as per the defined technical evaluation criteria. The technical evaluation criteria may be based on, but not limited to:
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that assigned individuals or the Tendering Committees perform the technical evaluation as per the defined technical evaluation criteria. The technical evaluation criteria may be based on, but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Ability to meet the specified requirements
texts.text: A1. Ability to meet the specified requirements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Innovation offered

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Delivery times and schedules offered
texts.text: A3. Delivery times and schedules offered

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Quality offered
texts.text: A4. Quality offered

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Experience of Supplier and personnel proposed
texts.text: A5. Experience of Supplier and personnel proposed

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Capability and capacity of the Supplier
texts.text: A6. Capability and capacity of the Supplier

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A7. Supplier's  management  practices  and  performance  on  occupational  health  and  safety, workplace and industrial relations and environment sustainability
texts.text: A7. Supplier's  management  practices  and  performance  on  occupational  health  and  safety, workplace and industrial relations and environment sustainability

texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement may request the End-users and the subject matter experts to be a part of the Tendering  Committee  for  the  technical  evaluation.  The  Tendering  Committee  shall  have  the necessary  skills  and  knowledge  to  carry  out  the  technical  evaluation  and  shall  be  free  from conflicts of interest that undermine the fairness of the process.
texts.text: The Procurement may request the End-users and the subject matter experts to be a part of the Tendering  Committee  for  the  technical  evaluation.  The  Tendering  Committee  shall  have  the necessary  skills  and  knowledge  to  carry  out  the  technical  evaluation  and  shall  be  free  from conflicts of interest that undermine the fairness of the process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  may  seek  clarification  regarding  the  submitted  technical  proposals  from participating Suppliers if allowed in the solicitation document. The Procurement shall seek such clarifications individually and maintain confidentiality.
texts.text: The  Procurement  may  seek  clarification  regarding  the  submitted  technical  proposals  from participating Suppliers if allowed in the solicitation document. The Procurement shall seek such clarifications individually and maintain confidentiality.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure preparation of the technical evaluation report, summarising the results of the evaluation, a list of qualified Suppliers and recommendations for further action.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure preparation of the technical evaluation report, summarising the results of the evaluation, a list of qualified Suppliers and recommendations for further action.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.18. Commercial Evaluation
texts.text: 10.18. Commercial Evaluation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall carry out commercial proposal review of technically qualified Suppliers with an additional focus on arithmetic errors, anomalies, pricing distortions, front-end loading of rates and unrealistically low bids. The Procurement may request the Finance and the Endusers to be a part of the commercial evaluation.
texts.text: The Procurement shall carry out commercial proposal review of technically qualified Suppliers with an additional focus on arithmetic errors, anomalies, pricing distortions, front-end loading of rates and unrealistically low bids. The Procurement may request the Finance and the Endusers to be a part of the commercial evaluation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: If mandated by the PDoA, the Procurement shall engage the Tendering Committee to perform the commercial evaluation.
texts.text: If mandated by the PDoA, the Procurement shall engage the Tendering Committee to perform the commercial evaluation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The submitted commercial proposals shall be reviewed against benchmarks from the historical pricing for goods, services and projects, pricing insights obtained from market intelligence and Total  Cost  of  Ownership  model.  If  required,  the  Procurement  may  ask  Suppliers  to  provide detailed  breakdown  or  clarifications  regarding  the  submitted  commercial  proposals.  The Procurement shall seek such clarifications individually and maintain confidentiality.
texts.text: The submitted commercial proposals shall be reviewed against benchmarks from the historical pricing for goods, services and projects, pricing insights obtained from market intelligence and Total  Cost  of  Ownership  model.  If  required,  the  Procurement  may  ask  Suppliers  to  provide detailed  breakdown  or  clarifications  regarding  the  submitted  commercial  proposals.  The Procurement shall seek such clarifications individually and maintain confidentiality.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: In  case  of  abnormally  or  unrealistically  low  bids,  the  Procurement  must  seek  detailed clarifications  of  the  commercial  offer  from  the  Supplier  including  price  calculations.  The Procurement shall consider such a commercial offer as valid, only if sufficient and satisfactory clarifications have been received from the Supplier.
texts.text: In  case  of  abnormally  or  unrealistically  low  bids,  the  Procurement  must  seek  detailed clarifications  of  the  commercial  offer  from  the  Supplier  including  price  calculations.  The Procurement shall consider such a commercial offer as valid, only if sufficient and satisfactory clarifications have been received from the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  prepare  a  report  on  commercial  proposals  review  containing,  at  the minimum:
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  prepare  a  report  on  commercial  proposals  review  containing,  at  the minimum:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E1. Details of arithmetic errors, anomalies, pricing distortions and unrealistically low bids
texts.text: E1. Details of arithmetic errors, anomalies, pricing distortions and unrealistically low bids

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E2. Summary  of  submitted  commercial  proposals  against  a  benchmark  or  lowest  received pricing
texts.text: E2. Summary  of  submitted  commercial  proposals  against  a  benchmark  or  lowest  received pricing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: E3. Ranking  of  commercial  proposals  by  price  or  total  cost  appropriately  adjusted  by eliminating errors and miscalculations
texts.text: E3. Ranking  of  commercial  proposals  by  price  or  total  cost  appropriately  adjusted  by eliminating errors and miscalculations

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.19. Negotiations Guidelines
texts.text: 10.19. Negotiations Guidelines

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall conduct negotiations with the most competitive qualified Suppliers to get the best possible value when:
texts.text: The Procurement shall conduct negotiations with the most competitive qualified Suppliers to get the best possible value when:

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Conditions for competitive bidding have not been optimal
texts.text: A1. Conditions for competitive bidding have not been optimal

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Received offers are unreasonable or with unacceptable terms and conditions
texts.text: A2. Received offers are unreasonable or with unacceptable terms and conditions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. The lowest offer is higher than estimates or available funds
texts.text: A3. The lowest offer is higher than estimates or available funds

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. There is a potential to drive down the prices
texts.text: A4. There is a potential to drive down the prices

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. In case of Sole Source or Single Source tenders
texts.text: A5. In case of Sole Source or Single Source tenders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement may conduct negotiations with the most competitive qualified Suppliers if such option  has  been  defined  in  the  solicitation  document  or  if  approved  by  the  head  of  the Procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement may conduct negotiations with the most competitive qualified Suppliers if such option  has  been  defined  in  the  solicitation  document  or  if  approved  by  the  head  of  the Procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  may  request  approval  from  the  head  of  the  Procurement  not  to  conduct negotiations if the estimated cost of delay to the project outweighs the potential benefits.
texts.text: The  Procurement  may  request  approval  from  the  head  of  the  Procurement  not  to  conduct negotiations if the estimated cost of delay to the project outweighs the potential benefits.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall adhere to the following guidelines while entering negotiations:
texts.text: The Procurement shall adhere to the following guidelines while entering negotiations:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D1. Original and negotiated offers shall remain confidential and must not be discussed with other Suppliers.
texts.text: D1. Original and negotiated offers shall remain confidential and must not be discussed with other Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D2. Suppliers shall not be given the impression that entering negotiations in any way assures them of success.
texts.text: D2. Suppliers shall not be given the impression that entering negotiations in any way assures them of success.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D3. Integrity  shall  be  maintained,  and  the  Code  of  Business  Ethics  shall  be  followed  during negotiations.
texts.text: D3. Integrity  shall  be  maintained,  and  the  Code  of  Business  Ethics  shall  be  followed  during negotiations.

texts.label: list_item

texts.orig: 10.20. Negotiations Execution
texts.text: 10.20. Negotiations Execution

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  form  a  team  for  negotiations  consisting  at  minimum  two  members representing the Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories, the End-users, the  Finance  or  the  Legal,  as  required.  The  team  for  negotiations  shall  prepare  a  plan  for negotiations by taking into consideration potential areas such as price, terms and conditions, contract period, implementation timelines and scope.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  form  a  team  for  negotiations  consisting  at  minimum  two  members representing the Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories, the End-users, the  Finance  or  the  Legal,  as  required.  The  team  for  negotiations  shall  prepare  a  plan  for negotiations by taking into consideration potential areas such as price, terms and conditions, contract period, implementation timelines and scope.

texts.label: list_item

The  Tendering  Committee  or  individuals  who  have conducted the technical evaluations, commercial evaluations and negotiations may be called upon to explain the reason behind their approach and the recommendation.

The  Tendering  Committee  or  individuals  who  have conducted the technical evaluations, commercial evaluations and negotiations may be called upon to explain the reason behind their approach and the recommendation.

texts.text: 10.22. Resolving Ties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall resolve situations where tie exists between two or more Suppliers' offers having identical prices that meet all specifications, terms, and conditions.
texts.text: The Procurement shall resolve situations where tie exists between two or more Suppliers' offers having identical prices that meet all specifications, terms, and conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: In cases of the tie and if possible and agreed by Suppliers, the Procurement shall allocate Multiple Awards for the contract.
texts.text: In cases of the tie and if possible and agreed by Suppliers, the Procurement shall allocate Multiple Awards for the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: In case it is not feasible to split the contract, the Procurement may resolve the tie by considering the following factors:

texts.text: The Procurement shall endeavour to remedy any protest received. The Procurement shall put the  solicitation  on  hold  until  the  reason  for  protest  has  been  satisfactorily  resolved,  at  the minimum under the following circumstances:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.25. Successful Supplier Withdrawal
texts.text: 10.25. Successful Supplier Withdrawal

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the event the successful Supplier withdraws or rejects the award, the Procurement on behalf of the government entity has the right to confiscate the bid bond and shall call upon the next eligible Supplier to sign the contract. In case of Sole Source or Single Source tenders, the solicitation shall be re-floated. The Procurement shall ensure that the Suppliers' withdrawal information is recorded in the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: In the event the successful Supplier withdraws or rejects the award, the Procurement on behalf of the government entity has the right to confiscate the bid bond and shall call upon the next eligible Supplier to sign the contract. In case of Sole Source or Single Source tenders, the solicitation shall be re-floated. The Procurement shall ensure that the Suppliers' withdrawal information is recorded in the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10.27. Guidelines for Contracting
texts.text: 10.27. Guidelines for Contracting

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall adhere to the following guidelines while contracting:
texts.text: The Procurement shall adhere to the following guidelines while contracting:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. All  contracting  for  goods,  services  and  projects  must  go  through  the  appropriate solicitation method.
texts.text: A1. All  contracting  for  goods,  services  and  projects  must  go  through  the  appropriate solicitation method.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. The  Procurement  is  encouraged  to  use  Contract  templates,  terms  and  conditions  preapproved by the Legal and the Finance; any deviations shall require appropriate approvals.
texts.text: A2. The  Procurement  is  encouraged  to  use  Contract  templates,  terms  and  conditions  preapproved by the Legal and the Finance; any deviations shall require appropriate approvals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. The availability of the approved budget must be verified before signing of the contract. The contract shall not directly commit the budget. The commitment of the budget shall be through issuing of the order executing the contract.
texts.text: A3. The availability of the approved budget must be verified before signing of the contract. The contract shall not directly commit the budget. The commitment of the budget shall be through issuing of the order executing the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Contracts must be signed by the appropriate authority authorised to commit on behalf of the government entity as per the PDoA.
texts.text: A4. Contracts must be signed by the appropriate authority authorised to commit on behalf of the government entity as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. For each contract, the Procurement shall ensure issuance of relevant order before Supplier commences the work.
texts.text: A5. For each contract, the Procurement shall ensure issuance of relevant order before Supplier commences the work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: F1. The  responsibility  of  the  primary  Supplier  to  inform  and  obtain  permission  from  the government entity to engage sub-contractors listing the activities and deliverables to be sub-contracted.
texts.text: F1. The  responsibility  of  the  primary  Supplier  to  inform  and  obtain  permission  from  the government entity to engage sub-contractors listing the activities and deliverables to be sub-contracted.

texts.text: F6. Exclusion of any liability of the government entity towards the sub-contractors

texts.text: F8. Indemnification  of  the  government  entity  from  claims,  civil  liabilities  or  any  legal proceedings initiated by the sub-contractors directly against the government entity

texts.orig: Section 11: Contract Lifecycle Management

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.1. Introduction
texts.text: 11.1. Introduction

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement through the implementation of contract lifecycle management shall ensure:
texts.text: The Procurement through the implementation of contract lifecycle management shall ensure:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. All contractual obligations are met in accordance with their respective schedules.
texts.text: A1. All contractual obligations are met in accordance with their respective schedules.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Any necessary amendments or changes to scope, terms, and conditions are authorised, agreed with the Supplier and incorporated into the contract.
texts.text: A2. Any necessary amendments or changes to scope, terms, and conditions are authorised, agreed with the Supplier and incorporated into the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Supplier  performance  is  tracked  and  shared  with  the  involved  stakeholders  and  the Supplier.
texts.text: A3. Supplier  performance  is  tracked  and  shared  with  the  involved  stakeholders  and  the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Remedial action is taken in the event of unsatisfactory performance.
texts.text: A4. Remedial action is taken in the event of unsatisfactory performance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Claims for compensation, penalties and liquidated damages for delay are verified promptly, and financial reimbursement to the Supplier is adjusted.
texts.text: A5. Claims for compensation, penalties and liquidated damages for delay are verified promptly, and financial reimbursement to the Supplier is adjusted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Price  variations,  extensions  and  amendments  are  agreed,  fall  within  bounds  of  the contracted conditions, and are implemented only after prior approval from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: A6. Price  variations,  extensions  and  amendments  are  agreed,  fall  within  bounds  of  the contracted conditions, and are implemented only after prior approval from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A7. Correspondence between the Procurement and the Supplier is appropriately recorded to ensure transparency and probity.
texts.text: A7. Correspondence between the Procurement and the Supplier is appropriately recorded to ensure transparency and probity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A8. Proper  signoffs  to  contract  close-out  are  obtained,  and  end  of  contract  review  of  the Supplier's performance is conducted, documented and discussed with the Supplier.
texts.text: A8. Proper  signoffs  to  contract  close-out  are  obtained,  and  end  of  contract  review  of  the Supplier's performance is conducted, documented and discussed with the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A9. Risks associated with executing and implementing a contract are identified and mitigated.
texts.text: A9. Risks associated with executing and implementing a contract are identified and mitigated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A10. Differences in the interpretation of the contract which arise over its lifecycle are resolved.
texts.text: A10. Differences in the interpretation of the contract which arise over its lifecycle are resolved.

texts.text: 11.2. Purpose of Involved Stakeholders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  be  responsible  for  managing  or  monitoring  the  management  of  the contract over its lifecycle, covering activities such as contract administration, ongoing contract execution, performance tracking, termination, and close-out.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  be  responsible  for  managing  or  monitoring  the  management  of  the contract over its lifecycle, covering activities such as contract administration, ongoing contract execution, performance tracking, termination, and close-out.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The Procurement shall assist the End-users who are acting as contract administrators in the dayto-day operations with Suppliers. In case, the Procurement is acting on behalf of the End-users, then the Procurement shall act as contract administrator.

texts.text: The Procurement shall conduct, if requested, a kick-off meeting with Suppliers to re-visit key deliverables, milestones, performance expectations and payment schedule for the contract. The Procurement shall invite the End-users and subject matter experts to the kick-off meeting.

texts.text: The Procurement may organise and lead the periodic review meetings with Suppliers, involving required stakeholders.

texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that purchases are within contracted guidelines.
