texts.orig: The Procurement shall inform and engage the Legal and the Finance in case of amendments, renewals, extensions, disputes, terminations and close-outs of contracts.
texts.text: The Procurement shall inform and engage the Legal and the Finance in case of amendments, renewals, extensions, disputes, terminations and close-outs of contracts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.3. Contract Records Management
texts.text: 11.3. Contract Records Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall maintain the contract records. The Procurement Practitioners responsible for administering contracts shall be responsible for maintaining the records. Original copy  of  the  signed  contract  and  all  associated  documents  shall  be  filed  physically,  and  the electronic copy shall be made available through the Procurement Gate. The Procurement shall ensure  that  the  contract  and  all  associated  documents  are  circulated  and  accessible  to  all relevant stakeholders.
texts.text: The Procurement shall maintain the contract records. The Procurement Practitioners responsible for administering contracts shall be responsible for maintaining the records. Original copy  of  the  signed  contract  and  all  associated  documents  shall  be  filed  physically,  and  the electronic copy shall be made available through the Procurement Gate. The Procurement shall ensure  that  the  contract  and  all  associated  documents  are  circulated  and  accessible  to  all relevant stakeholders.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Contract records shall include, at the minimum, the following:
texts.text: Contract records shall include, at the minimum, the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Copy  of  fully  executed  contract  with  its  appendices  if  applicable  or  master  services agreement, amendments, renewals, extensions
texts.text: B1. Copy  of  fully  executed  contract  with  its  appendices  if  applicable  or  master  services agreement, amendments, renewals, extensions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Supplier contact information and statutory registration certificates
texts.text: B2. Supplier contact information and statutory registration certificates

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Copies of all correspondence related to award communication, negotiations of terms and conditions, contract amendments, extensions and renewals
texts.text: B3. Copies of all correspondence related to award communication, negotiations of terms and conditions, contract amendments, extensions and renewals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Schedule of dates regarding deliverables, reporting and payments
texts.text: B4. Schedule of dates regarding deliverables, reporting and payments

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B5. Documents regarding Supplier performance review, claims and disputes
texts.text: B5. Documents regarding Supplier performance review, claims and disputes

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B6. Documentation of any corrective action
texts.text: B6. Documentation of any corrective action

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B7. Close-out documentation
texts.text: B7. Close-out documentation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall maintain the contracts records for the minimum retention period defined in the applicable legislations.
texts.text: The Procurement shall maintain the contracts records for the minimum retention period defined in the applicable legislations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.4. Contract Monitoring
texts.text: 11.4. Contract Monitoring

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall monitor the key aspects of contract proactively to reduce commercial and  substantive  risks.  Contract  milestones,  expiry  date,  and  utilisation  shall  be  tracked  and reported on a regular basis.
texts.text: The Procurement shall monitor the key aspects of contract proactively to reduce commercial and  substantive  risks.  Contract  milestones,  expiry  date,  and  utilisation  shall  be  tracked  and reported on a regular basis.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Contract monitoring shall enable decisions to be taken by the Procurement regarding variations, amendments, renewals, disputes, and claims.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for administering contracts shall be responsible for contract monitoring.
texts.text: Contract monitoring shall enable decisions to be taken by the Procurement regarding variations, amendments, renewals, disputes, and claims.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for administering contracts shall be responsible for contract monitoring.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.5. Contract Amendments
texts.text: 11.5. Contract Amendments

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall assess the request for amending contracts submitted by the End-users or Suppliers.  Amendments  to  contracts  shall  be  acknowledged  and  signed  by authorised representatives of the government entity and Supplier. The Procurement shall handle contract amendments by the type of amendment requested:
texts.text: The Procurement shall assess the request for amending contracts submitted by the End-users or Suppliers.  Amendments  to  contracts  shall  be  acknowledged  and  signed  by authorised representatives of the government entity and Supplier. The Procurement shall handle contract amendments by the type of amendment requested:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Administrative amendments refer to changes that do not affect or alter the rights of the government entity or Supplier. These include, but are not limited to, changes in billing instruction or address, corrections of typographical errors, and other changes permitted by  contract  clauses.  Administrative  amendments  do  not  cause  a  financial  nor  material impact.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  administering  the  contract  shall process all administrative amendments and shall inform all involved stakeholders such as the Finance, the Legal, the End-users and the Suppliers.
texts.text: A1. Administrative amendments refer to changes that do not affect or alter the rights of the government entity or Supplier. These include, but are not limited to, changes in billing instruction or address, corrections of typographical errors, and other changes permitted by  contract  clauses.  Administrative  amendments  do  not  cause  a  financial  nor  material impact.  The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  administering  the  contract  shall process all administrative amendments and shall inform all involved stakeholders such as the Finance, the Legal, the End-users and the Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Substantive  amendments  refer  to  changes  in  the  contract  that  affect  the  rights  and obligations  of  the  government  entity  or  Supplier.  They  include  but  are  not  limited  to, changes  in  prices,  schedules,  quantities,  scope,  specification,  terms  and  conditions. Approval of the substantive amendment shall be obtained from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: A2. Substantive  amendments  refer  to  changes  in  the  contract  that  affect  the  rights  and obligations  of  the  government  entity  or  Supplier.  They  include  but  are  not  limited  to, changes  in  prices,  schedules,  quantities,  scope,  specification,  terms  and  conditions. Approval of the substantive amendment shall be obtained from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall seek endorsement from the Legal, the Finance, the End-users or the subject matter expert as per the nature of the amendments.
texts.text: The Procurement shall seek endorsement from the Legal, the Finance, the End-users or the subject matter expert as per the nature of the amendments.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: While amending contract relating to the procurements of projects, the Procurement shall verify the  agreement  of  the  End-user  of  the  project  and  if  necessary  consult  with  the  Tendering Committee.
texts.text: While amending contract relating to the procurements of projects, the Procurement shall verify the  agreement  of  the  End-user  of  the  project  and  if  necessary  consult  with  the  Tendering Committee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall seek updates to guarantees, performance bonds and advanced payment guarantees from the Supplier as applicable for the amended contract.
texts.text: The Procurement shall seek updates to guarantees, performance bonds and advanced payment guarantees from the Supplier as applicable for the amended contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement  shall issue an amendment  to  the  order or shall issue new  order accommodating the contract amendment to allow for its execution.
texts.text: The Procurement  shall issue an amendment  to  the  order or shall issue new  order accommodating the contract amendment to allow for its execution.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.6. Contract Extension
texts.text: 11.6. Contract Extension

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The contract extension may be requested by the End-users or initiated by the Procurement when acting on behalf of the End-users at their request. The contract may be extended before its expiry. The extension shall be subject to the same provisions, scope, specification, terms and conditions as the existing contract.
texts.text: The contract extension may be requested by the End-users or initiated by the Procurement when acting on behalf of the End-users at their request. The contract may be extended before its expiry. The extension shall be subject to the same provisions, scope, specification, terms and conditions as the existing contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Approval for contract extension shall be obtained from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The Approval for contract extension shall be obtained from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  extension  shall  be  acknowledged  and  signed  by  authorised  representatives  of  the government  entity  and  Supplier.  Updated  guarantees,  performance  bonds  and  advanced payment guarantees shall be requested from the Supplier when applicable.
texts.text: The  extension  shall  be  acknowledged  and  signed  by  authorised  representatives  of  the government  entity  and  Supplier.  Updated  guarantees,  performance  bonds  and  advanced payment guarantees shall be requested from the Supplier when applicable.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement  shall issue an amendment  to  the  order or shall issue new  order accommodating the contract extension to allow for its execution.
texts.text: The Procurement  shall issue an amendment  to  the  order or shall issue new  order accommodating the contract extension to allow for its execution.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.7. Contract Renewals
texts.text: 11.7. Contract Renewals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Contract  renewals  shall  be  permitted  if  relevant  provision  allowing  for  renewal  exists  in  the contract.
texts.text: Contract  renewals  shall  be  permitted  if  relevant  provision  allowing  for  renewal  exists  in  the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that there is a valid justification for renewal and the contract is renewed at the same terms and conditions.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that there is a valid justification for renewal and the contract is renewed at the same terms and conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Approval for contract renewal shall be obtained from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: Approval for contract renewal shall be obtained from the relevant authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall verify that sufficient approved budget is available for the renewal of the contract.  The  Procurement  shall  amend  an  existing  order  or  issue  a  new  order  to  execute contract renewal. Updated guarantees, performance bonds shall be requested from the Supplier as applicable.
texts.text: The Procurement shall verify that sufficient approved budget is available for the renewal of the contract.  The  Procurement  shall  amend  an  existing  order  or  issue  a  new  order  to  execute contract renewal. Updated guarantees, performance bonds shall be requested from the Supplier as applicable.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.8. Managing Performance and Compliance
texts.text: 11.8. Managing Performance and Compliance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners responsible for administering contracts shall be responsible for managing  the  performance  of  contract  execution  and  compliance  based  on  the  following parameters:
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners responsible for administering contracts shall be responsible for managing  the  performance  of  contract  execution  and  compliance  based  on  the  following parameters:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Timelines and milestones
texts.text: A1. Timelines and milestones

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Quality of procured goods, services or projects
texts.text: A2. Quality of procured goods, services or projects

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Compliance with contractual obligations
texts.text: A3. Compliance with contractual obligations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Key performance indicators and service level agreement
texts.text: A4. Key performance indicators and service level agreement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Savings targets
texts.text: A5. Savings targets

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  perform  audits  and  reviews  to  measure  performance  and  confirm compliance. Savings shall be monitored to compare actual savings against projected savings.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  perform  audits  and  reviews  to  measure  performance  and  confirm compliance. Savings shall be monitored to compare actual savings against projected savings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement  shall ensure the creation of corrective action plans and drive the implementation of corrective actions to achieve required performance and compliance. Supplier shall be given sufficient time to remedy the performance and compliance issues.
texts.text: The Procurement  shall ensure the creation of corrective action plans and drive the implementation of corrective actions to achieve required performance and compliance. Supplier shall be given sufficient time to remedy the performance and compliance issues.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.9. Claims and Disputes
texts.text: 11.9. Claims and Disputes

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  manage  or  supervise  the  management  of  claims  to  obtain  due compensation  or  monetary  recovery  from  the  Supplier  for  failure  to  perform  or  fulfil
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  manage  or  supervise  the  management  of  claims  to  obtain  due compensation  or  monetary  recovery  from  the  Supplier  for  failure  to  perform  or  fulfil

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: requirements as per the contract after consultation with the Legal. The Procurement may seek inputs from the End-users or the Finance.
texts.text: requirements as per the contract after consultation with the Legal. The Procurement may seek inputs from the End-users or the Finance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  documentation  of  the  claims  substantiated  with  details  of Supplier's  failure  to  perform  or  to  meet  contractual  obligations  and  the  resulting  monetary implication. Claims shall be enforced through penalties, liquidated damages and other applicable terms and conditions.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  documentation  of  the  claims  substantiated  with  details  of Supplier's  failure  to  perform  or  to  meet  contractual  obligations  and  the  resulting  monetary implication. Claims shall be enforced through penalties, liquidated damages and other applicable terms and conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  the  Finance  is  immediately  notified  after  the  identification  of issues  that  may  lead  to  potential  claims  and  disputes.  The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that invoices, advanced payment guarantees and performance bonds are put on hold until claims are resolved.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  the  Finance  is  immediately  notified  after  the  identification  of issues  that  may  lead  to  potential  claims  and  disputes.  The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that invoices, advanced payment guarantees and performance bonds are put on hold until claims are resolved.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall communicate raised claims to the Suppliers. If there are no objections by the Suppliers, then the claims settlement shall be managed by the Finance.
texts.text: The Procurement shall communicate raised claims to the Suppliers. If there are no objections by the Suppliers, then the claims settlement shall be managed by the Finance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  register  and  analyse  any  dispute  raised  by  the  Supplier  in  case  of  a perceived  breach  of  the  contractual  obligations.  The  Procurement  shall  manage  disputes  in consultation with the Legal, the Finance and the End-users.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  register  and  analyse  any  dispute  raised  by  the  Supplier  in  case  of  a perceived  breach  of  the  contractual  obligations.  The  Procurement  shall  manage  disputes  in consultation with the Legal, the Finance and the End-users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall endeavour to settle disputes amicably with the Supplier. If the dispute is not settled amicably, it shall be resolved through the established redressal mechanism.
texts.text: The Procurement shall endeavour to settle disputes amicably with the Supplier. If the dispute is not settled amicably, it shall be resolved through the established redressal mechanism.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.10. Termination for Convenience
texts.text: 11.10. Termination for Convenience

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Termination for convenience may be initiated by the Procurement or requested by the End-users and Suppliers as per the provisions of the Contract.
texts.text: Termination for convenience may be initiated by the Procurement or requested by the End-users and Suppliers as per the provisions of the Contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Termination for convenience may be initiated to preserve the government entity's interest and implement the directives of the executive management.
texts.text: Termination for convenience may be initiated to preserve the government entity's interest and implement the directives of the executive management.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall seek advice from the Legal to determine whether the events or conditions allow for termination for convenience. Approval for the termination shall be obtained in line with the original solicitation process.
texts.text: The Procurement shall seek advice from the Legal to determine whether the events or conditions allow for termination for convenience. Approval for the termination shall be obtained in line with the original solicitation process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall notify Supplier through a formal written notice specifying the extent of termination, the reason for termination and the effective date of termination when the Supplier shall cease services, the supply of goods and termination of projects.
texts.text: The Procurement shall notify Supplier through a formal written notice specifying the extent of termination, the reason for termination and the effective date of termination when the Supplier shall cease services, the supply of goods and termination of projects.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.11. Termination for Default
texts.text: 11.11. Termination for Default

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  termination  for  default  shall  be  initiated  by  the  Procurement.  The  End-users  may  also request the Procurement to initiate the process of termination for default.
texts.text: The  termination  for  default  shall  be  initiated  by  the  Procurement.  The  End-users  may  also request the Procurement to initiate the process of termination for default.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall give the Supplier a sufficient cure period to rectify performance issues and meet its contractual obligations. Termination for default shall be used as a last resort and shall be invoked including but not limited to the following circumstances:
texts.text: The Procurement shall give the Supplier a sufficient cure period to rectify performance issues and meet its contractual obligations. Termination for default shall be used as a last resort and shall be invoked including but not limited to the following circumstances:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Continuous unsatisfactory performance of Supplier putting the contract execution at risk
texts.text: B1. Continuous unsatisfactory performance of Supplier putting the contract execution at risk

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Failure of Suppliers to mobilise within the contracted timeframe
texts.text: B2. Failure of Suppliers to mobilise within the contracted timeframe

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Refusal of the Supplier to comply with reasonable instructions allowed under the contract
texts.text: B3. Refusal of the Supplier to comply with reasonable instructions allowed under the contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. General breach of the provisions of the contract
texts.text: B4. General breach of the provisions of the contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  prepare  a  case  for  termination  for  default  which  shall  include  the government entity's and Supplier's liabilities. The Procurement shall seek input from the Endusers and the Legal.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  prepare  a  case  for  termination  for  default  which  shall  include  the government entity's and Supplier's liabilities. The Procurement shall seek input from the Endusers and the Legal.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  obtain  approval  for  termination  for  default  in  line  with  the  original solicitation process and shall formally issue a termination notice to the Supplier, after verification by the Legal and the Finance.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  obtain  approval  for  termination  for  default  in  line  with  the  original solicitation process and shall formally issue a termination notice to the Supplier, after verification by the Legal and the Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.12. Payment upon Termination
texts.text: 11.12. Payment upon Termination

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall determine the amount of payment due to the Supplier upon termination, as per the relevant terms and conditions of the contract.
texts.text: The Procurement shall determine the amount of payment due to the Supplier upon termination, as per the relevant terms and conditions of the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  inform  the  Finance  regarding  the  amounts  of  all  applicable  claims, deductions, penalties, and liquidated damages which must be deducted. If the due amount is less  than  the  total  applicable  deductions,  the  residual  amount  shall  be  deducted  from  the performance bonds, retentions or the advance payment guarantees. In case of termination due to  Supplier's  default,  and  depending  on  the  provisions  of  the  contract,  the  whole  or  partial amount of the performance bond may be appropriated, in coordination with the Legal and the Finance.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  inform  the  Finance  regarding  the  amounts  of  all  applicable  claims, deductions, penalties, and liquidated damages which must be deducted. If the due amount is less  than  the  total  applicable  deductions,  the  residual  amount  shall  be  deducted  from  the performance bonds, retentions or the advance payment guarantees. In case of termination due to  Supplier's  default,  and  depending  on  the  provisions  of  the  contract,  the  whole  or  partial amount of the performance bond may be appropriated, in coordination with the Legal and the Finance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that no-due acknowledgement is received from the Supplier at the time of releasing due payment.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that no-due acknowledgement is received from the Supplier at the time of releasing due payment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.13. Supplier Replacement
texts.text: 11.13. Supplier Replacement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall initiate solicitation process to replace the Supplier before the contract is terminated with the incumbent Supplier if needed.
texts.text: The Procurement shall initiate solicitation process to replace the Supplier before the contract is terminated with the incumbent Supplier if needed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement may engage a Supplier provisionally without solicitation for the performance of services, the supply of goods or delivery of projects, if requested by the End-users and if there are serious business implications.
texts.text: The Procurement may engage a Supplier provisionally without solicitation for the performance of services, the supply of goods or delivery of projects, if requested by the End-users and if there are serious business implications.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  preparation  of  the  business  case  and  get  approval  from appropriate authority as per the PDoA before provisionally engaging the Supplier.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  preparation  of  the  business  case  and  get  approval  from appropriate authority as per the PDoA before provisionally engaging the Supplier.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.14. Contract Fulfilment Criteria
texts.text: 11.14. Contract Fulfilment Criteria

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  contract  shall  be  deemed  fulfilled  when  both  the  government  entity  and  Supplier  have fulfilled  their  contractual  obligations  and  no  responsibilities  remain.  The  contract  shall  be considered fulfilled when:
texts.text: The  contract  shall  be  deemed  fulfilled  when  both  the  government  entity  and  Supplier  have fulfilled  their  contractual  obligations  and  no  responsibilities  remain.  The  contract  shall  be considered fulfilled when:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. All goods, services and projects have been received and accepted
texts.text: A1. All goods, services and projects have been received and accepted

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. All requirements are completed and documentation finalised
texts.text: A2. All requirements are completed and documentation finalised

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. All administrative actions have been completed
texts.text: A3. All administrative actions have been completed

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. All issues, claims, and disputes have been resolved
texts.text: A4. All issues, claims, and disputes have been resolved

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. All known payments due to the Supplier have been authorised and disbursed, including the release of Performance Bond and other guarantees or retentions as applicable
texts.text: A5. All known payments due to the Supplier have been authorised and disbursed, including the release of Performance Bond and other guarantees or retentions as applicable

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall be responsible for determining if the contract may be considered fulfilled. The  Procurement  shall  prepare  the  close-out  report  ensuring  agreement  of  all  involved stakeholders, including the Supplier.
texts.text: The Procurement shall be responsible for determining if the contract may be considered fulfilled. The  Procurement  shall  prepare  the  close-out  report  ensuring  agreement  of  all  involved stakeholders, including the Supplier.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.15. Warranties
texts.text: 11.15. Warranties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure management of warranties as per the provisions of the contract.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure management of warranties as per the provisions of the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Suppliers may be required to submit a retention amount for the period of the warranty.
texts.text: Suppliers may be required to submit a retention amount for the period of the warranty.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11.16. Final Close-out
texts.text: 11.16. Final Close-out

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The contract shall be closed-out when the obligations of the government entity and Supplier have been fulfilled and there are no pending claims or disputes. The Procurement shall manage close-out of the contract adhering to the below:
texts.text: The contract shall be closed-out when the obligations of the government entity and Supplier have been fulfilled and there are no pending claims or disputes. The Procurement shall manage close-out of the contract adhering to the below:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Final acceptance of goods, services and projects shall be verified by the Procurement. The Procurement may seek input from the End-users and subject matter experts if required. Approval of final acceptance shall be obtained in line with the original solicitation process.
texts.text: A1. Final acceptance of goods, services and projects shall be verified by the Procurement. The Procurement may seek input from the End-users and subject matter experts if required. Approval of final acceptance shall be obtained in line with the original solicitation process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. The  Supplier performance  evaluation  shall be initiated  by  the  Procurement.  The Procurement  shall  seek  inputs  from  involved  stakeholders  on  the  performance  of  the Supplier on contractual obligations, delivery milestones, quantity, quality, adherence to scope  of  services  and  projects  or  goods  specification,  key  performance  indicators  and service  level  agreement.  The  evaluation  of  Supplier  performance  must  be  carried  out before  payment  of  dues  to  the  Supplier.  The  Supplier  performance  evaluation  shall  be recorded in the Procurement Gate and shall be taken into consideration for new sourcing events.
texts.text: A2. The  Supplier performance  evaluation  shall be initiated  by  the  Procurement.  The Procurement  shall  seek  inputs  from  involved  stakeholders  on  the  performance  of  the Supplier on contractual obligations, delivery milestones, quantity, quality, adherence to scope  of  services  and  projects  or  goods  specification,  key  performance  indicators  and service  level  agreement.  The  evaluation  of  Supplier  performance  must  be  carried  out before  payment  of  dues  to  the  Supplier.  The  Supplier  performance  evaluation  shall  be recorded in the Procurement Gate and shall be taken into consideration for new sourcing events.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Payment of dues to Supplier including the release of a performance bond and retention amount incase its validity is same as the Contract expiry. Any pending monetary claims, penalties or liquidated damages shall be adjusted from the final payment of dues to the Supplier.
texts.text: A3. Payment of dues to Supplier including the release of a performance bond and retention amount incase its validity is same as the Contract expiry. Any pending monetary claims, penalties or liquidated damages shall be adjusted from the final payment of dues to the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. The Procurement shall ensure that completion certificate is issued by the End-user to the Supplier acknowledging that it has satisfactorily performed its obligations, if required as per the contractual terms in addition to the receipt of goods, services and projects.
texts.text: A4. The Procurement shall ensure that completion certificate is issued by the End-user to the Supplier acknowledging that it has satisfactorily performed its obligations, if required as per the contractual terms in addition to the receipt of goods, services and projects.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 12: Supplier Relationship Management
texts.text: Section 12: Supplier Relationship Management

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.1. Supplier Registration
texts.text: 12.1. Supplier Registration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Supplier  registration  shall  be  done  in  the  Procurement  Gate  by  the  team  responsible  for managing the Supplier master data.
texts.text: Supplier  registration  shall  be  done  in  the  Procurement  Gate  by  the  team  responsible  for managing the Supplier master data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  the  Supplier  provides  the  information  required  for registration  including  but  not  limited  to  valid  trade  license  having  activities  relevant  for submitted categories, tax registration and banking details.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  the  Supplier  provides  the  information  required  for registration  including  but  not  limited  to  valid  trade  license  having  activities  relevant  for submitted categories, tax registration and banking details.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall carry out Supplier qualification once the Supplier has been registered in the Procurement Gate and has provided the necessary documentation.
texts.text: The Procurement shall carry out Supplier qualification once the Supplier has been registered in the Procurement Gate and has provided the necessary documentation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.2. Supplier Qualification
texts.text: 12.2. Supplier Qualification

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The team responsible for managing the Supplier master data shall qualify Suppliers to enable instant access to a pool of Suppliers deemed suitable to work with the government entity.
texts.text: The team responsible for managing the Supplier master data shall qualify Suppliers to enable instant access to a pool of Suppliers deemed suitable to work with the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The following aspects may be considered while qualifying Suppliers:
texts.text: The following aspects may be considered while qualifying Suppliers:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Demonstration of sound financial position
texts.text: B1. Demonstration of sound financial position

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Credible reputation of the supplier
texts.text: B2. Credible reputation of the supplier

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Experience in supplying goods, services and projects and related certifications
texts.text: B3. Experience in supplying goods, services and projects and related certifications

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Successful completion of contracts with reputable clients
texts.text: B4. Successful completion of contracts with reputable clients

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B5. Qualification  criteria  shall  be  adjusted  relatively  to  type  of  Supplier  and  its  year  of establishment
texts.text: B5. Qualification  criteria  shall  be  adjusted  relatively  to  type  of  Supplier  and  its  year  of establishment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The information shall be gathered from Suppliers using standardised templates available in the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: The information shall be gathered from Suppliers using standardised templates available in the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.3. Review of Registered Suppliers
texts.text: 12.3. Review of Registered Suppliers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall periodically review the list of registered Suppliers, with the aim to remove inactive Suppliers. The Procurement shall send a request to the team responsible for managing the Supplier master data for Supplier deactivation.
texts.text: The Procurement shall periodically review the list of registered Suppliers, with the aim to remove inactive Suppliers. The Procurement shall send a request to the team responsible for managing the Supplier master data for Supplier deactivation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall request the team responsible for managing the Supplier master data to blacklist Suppliers for period of one year, if approved by the Chairman of the government entity. The Suppliers may be blacklisted if they falsify information provided to the government entity or decline to sign the contract after being awarded.
texts.text: The Procurement shall request the team responsible for managing the Supplier master data to blacklist Suppliers for period of one year, if approved by the Chairman of the government entity. The Suppliers may be blacklisted if they falsify information provided to the government entity or decline to sign the contract after being awarded.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The team responsible for managing the Supplier master data shall deactivate the Suppliers who do not have an existing valid trade license.
texts.text: The team responsible for managing the Supplier master data shall deactivate the Suppliers who do not have an existing valid trade license.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.4. Supplier Segmentation
texts.text: 12.4. Supplier Segmentation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall segment Suppliers to manage and grow Supplier relationships, with the objective of increasing mutual benefits, optimising value from the relationship, and preventing supply disruptions.
texts.text: The Procurement shall segment Suppliers to manage and grow Supplier relationships, with the objective of increasing mutual benefits, optimising value from the relationship, and preventing supply disruptions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall consider at the minimum the following aspects while segmenting the Suppliers:
texts.text: The Procurement shall consider at the minimum the following aspects while segmenting the Suppliers:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Bargaining power of the Supplier
texts.text: B1. Bargaining power of the Supplier

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Spend with the Supplier
texts.text: B2. Spend with the Supplier

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Supplier's potential to grow, innovate and collaborate
texts.text: B3. Supplier's potential to grow, innovate and collaborate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Proven capability, track record, and performance
texts.text: B4. Proven capability, track record, and performance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Supplier segmentation criteria shall be approved by the head of the Procurement and shall be reviewed periodically to align with the business objectives.
texts.text: The Supplier segmentation criteria shall be approved by the head of the Procurement and shall be reviewed periodically to align with the business objectives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall perform Supplier segmentation at a regular frequency, to ensure that a Suppliers' classification reflects Suppliers' performance  and  their relationship with the government entity. The segmentation of the Supplier shall be reflected in the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: The Procurement shall perform Supplier segmentation at a regular frequency, to ensure that a Suppliers' classification reflects Suppliers' performance  and  their relationship with the government entity. The segmentation of the Supplier shall be reflected in the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  develop  specific  guidelines  to  manage  relationships  for  each  of  the Supplier segments.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  develop  specific  guidelines  to  manage  relationships  for  each  of  the Supplier segments.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.5. Guidelines for Managing Supplier Performance
texts.text: 12.5. Guidelines for Managing Supplier Performance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall drive ongoing and post contract Supplier performance management, at the minimum, adhering to the following guidelines:
texts.text: The Procurement shall drive ongoing and post contract Supplier performance management, at the minimum, adhering to the following guidelines:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. The performance evaluation shall be performed for all Suppliers periodically.
texts.text: A1. The performance evaluation shall be performed for all Suppliers periodically.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Supplier performance shall be recorded and made available in the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: A2. Supplier performance shall be recorded and made available in the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Results of performance evaluation shall be communicated to all Suppliers, encouraging open discussion and constructive feedback.
texts.text: A3. Results of performance evaluation shall be communicated to all Suppliers, encouraging open discussion and constructive feedback.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Corrective action plans shall be developed where necessary, providing Suppliers with an opportunity to improve.
texts.text: A4. Corrective action plans shall be developed where necessary, providing Suppliers with an opportunity to improve.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Supplier performance metric shall be approved by the head of the Procurement and shall be reviewed periodically to align with the business objectives.
texts.text: The Supplier performance metric shall be approved by the head of the Procurement and shall be reviewed periodically to align with the business objectives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  use  Supplier  performance  to  drive  relationships  which  lead  to  close collaboration, ensure continuity of supply, reduce risk, encourage innovation and generate value for the government entity and Supplier.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  use  Supplier  performance  to  drive  relationships  which  lead  to  close collaboration, ensure continuity of supply, reduce risk, encourage innovation and generate value for the government entity and Supplier.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.6. Supplier Performance Evaluation
texts.text: 12.6. Supplier Performance Evaluation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall drive the Supplier performance evaluation by analysing at the minimum, following parameters:
texts.text: The Procurement shall drive the Supplier performance evaluation by analysing at the minimum, following parameters:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Operational performance  including adherence to schedules agreed on rates or contracted prices, on-time delivery, adherence to schedules, and overdue orders
texts.text: A1. Operational performance  including adherence to schedules agreed on rates or contracted prices, on-time delivery, adherence to schedules, and overdue orders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Compliance with health, safety and environment guidelines
texts.text: A2. Compliance with health, safety and environment guidelines

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Response time to issues and avoiding escalation
texts.text: A3. Response time to issues and avoiding escalation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Participation in solicitation understood as the number of  goods, services and projects quoted against the total number of goods, services and projects in the solicitation
texts.text: A4. Participation in solicitation understood as the number of  goods, services and projects quoted against the total number of goods, services and projects in the solicitation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. History of withdrawal from contract execution after being successfully awarded
texts.text: A5. History of withdrawal from contract execution after being successfully awarded

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Number of claims and cases raised against the Supplier
texts.text: A6. Number of claims and cases raised against the Supplier

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Supplier performance evaluation shall include inputs from the End-users, the Finance, the Legal and the contract administrator. The Procurement Practitioners shall be responsible for signing off the results of Supplier performance evaluation for the categories they manage.
texts.text: The Supplier performance evaluation shall include inputs from the End-users, the Finance, the Legal and the contract administrator. The Procurement Practitioners shall be responsible for signing off the results of Supplier performance evaluation for the categories they manage.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall use relevant Supplier performance measures to increase the effectiveness of supply chain, and such performance measures with results shall be shared with Suppliers, to align performance understanding, enabling a collaborative approach for optimising the supply chain.
texts.text: The Procurement shall use relevant Supplier performance measures to increase the effectiveness of supply chain, and such performance measures with results shall be shared with Suppliers, to align performance understanding, enabling a collaborative approach for optimising the supply chain.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12.7. Supplier Feedback and Improvements
texts.text: 12.7. Supplier Feedback and Improvements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall conduct Supplier performance review meeting, at least once every year, to provide feedback to Suppliers based on their performance evaluation. The Procurement shall involve the End-users, the Finance and subject matter experts to discuss performance related issues. The discussion during such review meetings shall be constructive and shall encourage Suppliers to improve their performance.
texts.text: The Procurement shall conduct Supplier performance review meeting, at least once every year, to provide feedback to Suppliers based on their performance evaluation. The Procurement shall involve the End-users, the Finance and subject matter experts to discuss performance related issues. The discussion during such review meetings shall be constructive and shall encourage Suppliers to improve their performance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ask Suppliers to prepare corrective action plans to remedy performance related  issues.  The  plans  submitted  by  Suppliers  shall  be  reviewed  and  approved  by  the Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  managing  categories.  The  Procurement  may  seek validation from the End-users and subject matter experts if required.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ask Suppliers to prepare corrective action plans to remedy performance related  issues.  The  plans  submitted  by  Suppliers  shall  be  reviewed  and  approved  by  the Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  managing  categories.  The  Procurement  may  seek validation from the End-users and subject matter experts if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall track progress against milestones and ensure closure of issues mentioned in the corrective action plan.
texts.text: The Procurement shall track progress against milestones and ensure closure of issues mentioned in the corrective action plan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  managing  categories  shall  be  responsible  for providing  feedback  and  driving  performance  improvement  of  Suppliers  associated  with  the category.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Practitioners  responsible  for  managing  categories  shall  be  responsible  for providing  feedback  and  driving  performance  improvement  of  Suppliers  associated  with  the category.
