texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 13: Requisition to Pay
texts.text: Section 13: Requisition to Pay

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.1. Introduction
texts.text: 13.1. Introduction

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  objective  of  requisition  to  pay  is  to  provide  an  efficient  and  cost-effective  method  for purchasing goods, services and projects while at the same time ensuring the proper degree of control.
texts.text: The  objective  of  requisition  to  pay  is  to  provide  an  efficient  and  cost-effective  method  for purchasing goods, services and projects while at the same time ensuring the proper degree of control.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement and any employee of the government entity involved in procurement activity shall adhere to the following for requisition to pay:
texts.text: The Procurement and any employee of the government entity involved in procurement activity shall adhere to the following for requisition to pay:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Purchases shall be aligned with business needs and strategies
texts.text: B1. Purchases shall be aligned with business needs and strategies

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. Purchases adhere to governance controls to reduce risk and potential fraudulent activity
texts.text: B2. Purchases adhere to governance controls to reduce risk and potential fraudulent activity

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Purchases shall be documented and executed electronically through the Procurement Gate
texts.text: B3. Purchases shall be documented and executed electronically through the Procurement Gate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Purchases  shall  have  a  clear  audit  trail  capturing  document  transmission  between  the Procurement and Suppliers
texts.text: B4. Purchases  shall  have  a  clear  audit  trail  capturing  document  transmission  between  the Procurement and Suppliers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B5. Confidentiality agreements shall be signed by Suppliers prior sharing of any confidential information
texts.text: B5. Confidentiality agreements shall be signed by Suppliers prior sharing of any confidential information

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.2. Applicability and Involved Parties
texts.text: 13.2. Applicability and Involved Parties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Standards set here for the requisition to pay cycle apply to all goods, services and projects procured by the government entity.
texts.text: The Procurement Standards set here for the requisition to pay cycle apply to all goods, services and projects procured by the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall be the only organisational function within the government entity given exclusive rights to conduct procurement transactions.
texts.text: The Procurement shall be the only organisational function within the government entity given exclusive rights to conduct procurement transactions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.3. Buying Channels Enablement
texts.text: 13.3. Buying Channels Enablement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall use the available buying channels to fulfil requisitions raised by the Endusers through the Procurement Gate. The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall select for their categories appropriate buying channels based on but not limited to the following criteria:
texts.text: The Procurement shall use the available buying channels to fulfil requisitions raised by the Endusers through the Procurement Gate. The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall select for their categories appropriate buying channels based on but not limited to the following criteria:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Type of purchase
texts.text: A1. Type of purchase

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Value of purchase
texts.text: A2. Value of purchase

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Volume of purchase
texts.text: A3. Volume of purchase

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Category criticality
texts.text: A4. Category criticality

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Lead time
texts.text: A5. Lead time

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Required approvals
texts.text: A6. Required approvals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A7. Urgency
texts.text: A7. Urgency

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The use of buying channels shall be aligned to the PDoA for approvals based on value thresholds.
texts.text: The use of buying channels shall be aligned to the PDoA for approvals based on value thresholds.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.4. Guidance for Raising Requisition
texts.text: 13.4. Guidance for Raising Requisition

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users raise purchase requisitions in the Procurement Gate. The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users raising requisitions at the minimum:
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users raise purchase requisitions in the Procurement Gate. The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users raising requisitions at the minimum:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Identify the required quantities considering existing inventory and actual demand
texts.text: A1. Identify the required quantities considering existing inventory and actual demand

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Identify relevant category and if required develop specifications of the requirement
texts.text: A2. Identify relevant category and if required develop specifications of the requirement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Ensure that the specifications, scope, time plan are part of purchase requisition if required
texts.text: A3. Ensure that the specifications, scope, time plan are part of purchase requisition if required

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Estimate the budgeted spend for the purchase requisition
texts.text: A4. Estimate the budgeted spend for the purchase requisition

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that purchase requisitions are not split into several transactions as a result of poor planning and lack of coordination or to avoid proper threshold values that would require higher approval authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that purchase requisitions are not split into several transactions as a result of poor planning and lack of coordination or to avoid proper threshold values that would require higher approval authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Transactions shall not be routed through different buying channels to avoid authority approvals. When considering whether transactions should be combined, similar transactions must only be considered. The Procurement shall endeavour to satisfy the received requisitions, having them consolidated and addressed with an optimal number of orders.
texts.text: Transactions shall not be routed through different buying channels to avoid authority approvals. When considering whether transactions should be combined, similar transactions must only be considered. The Procurement shall endeavour to satisfy the received requisitions, having them consolidated and addressed with an optimal number of orders.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners shall be considered as the End-users for their own requisitions.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners shall be considered as the End-users for their own requisitions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.5. Requisition Approvals
texts.text: 13.5. Requisition Approvals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The purchase requisition shall be approved by the relevant authority according to the PDoA.
texts.text: The purchase requisition shall be approved by the relevant authority according to the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall coordinate with the Finance to ensure sufficient approved budget exists for the purchase requisition.
texts.text: The Procurement shall coordinate with the Finance to ensure sufficient approved budget exists for the purchase requisition.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall receive the purchase requisition after it has been approved in the Procurement Gate. They shall perform an initial check for completeness and take the necessary action for Purchase Order creation. In particular, stock availability must be checked before raising an order.
texts.text: The Procurement Practitioners responsible for managing categories shall receive the purchase requisition after it has been approved in the Procurement Gate. They shall perform an initial check for completeness and take the necessary action for Purchase Order creation. In particular, stock availability must be checked before raising an order.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The purchase requisitions processed by the Procurement may require further approval as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The purchase requisitions processed by the Procurement may require further approval as per the PDoA.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.6. Purchase Order
texts.text: 13.6. Purchase Order

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Purchase  Order  is  a  written  contract  between  the  government  entity  and  Suppliers  to procure goods, services and projects in reference to the Contract or the Price List Agreement or on a standalone basis. The Procurement is the only function allowed to create and issue orders to Suppliers.
texts.text: The  Purchase  Order  is  a  written  contract  between  the  government  entity  and  Suppliers  to procure goods, services and projects in reference to the Contract or the Price List Agreement or on a standalone basis. The Procurement is the only function allowed to create and issue orders to Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Every line item in the Purchase Order shall be assigned to one of the categories following the Category Hierarchy.
texts.text: Every line item in the Purchase Order shall be assigned to one of the categories following the Category Hierarchy.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall adhere to the following principles when creating an order:
texts.text: The Procurement shall adhere to the following principles when creating an order:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C1. Determine  need  based  on  the  purchase  requisition  and  prepare  specifications  to communicate with Suppliers
texts.text: C1. Determine  need  based  on  the  purchase  requisition  and  prepare  specifications  to communicate with Suppliers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C2. Select Supplier
texts.text: C2. Select Supplier

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C3. Negotiate appropriate business terms, if not already in place
texts.text: C3. Negotiate appropriate business terms, if not already in place

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C4. Agree on delivery terms and conditions
texts.text: C4. Agree on delivery terms and conditions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C5. Agree on payment terms
texts.text: C5. Agree on payment terms

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C6. Ensure necessary terms and conditions are put in place in the order itself or the underlying contract
texts.text: C6. Ensure necessary terms and conditions are put in place in the order itself or the underlying contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C7. Ensure purchase requisition exists and has been approved in the Procurement Gate
texts.text: C7. Ensure purchase requisition exists and has been approved in the Procurement Gate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall create Purchase Orders through the Procurement Gate. The Purchase Order must be created before committing to a Supplier.
texts.text: The Procurement shall create Purchase Orders through the Procurement Gate. The Purchase Order must be created before committing to a Supplier.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.7. Guidance for Releasing Purchase Orders
texts.text: 13.7. Guidance for Releasing Purchase Orders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Purchase  Order  shall  be  released  by  the  Procurement  to  the  Supplier  only  after  due approvals  have  been  obtained  from  appropriate  authorities  as  established  in  the  PDoA.  No Purchase Orders shall be released without approvals granted in the Procurement Gate.
texts.text: The  Purchase  Order  shall  be  released  by  the  Procurement  to  the  Supplier  only  after  due approvals  have  been  obtained  from  appropriate  authorities  as  established  in  the  PDoA.  No Purchase Orders shall be released without approvals granted in the Procurement Gate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.8. Purchases without Purchase Orders
texts.text: 13.8. Purchases without Purchase Orders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall create Purchase Orders for purchasing of all goods, services and projects unless the goods, services and projects are a part of the exemption list approved as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The Procurement shall create Purchase Orders for purchasing of all goods, services and projects unless the goods, services and projects are a part of the exemption list approved as per the PDoA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: At the minimum, the following guidelines shall be adhered to while placing orders with Suppliers for exempted goods, services and projects:
texts.text: At the minimum, the following guidelines shall be adhered to while placing orders with Suppliers for exempted goods, services and projects:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. The Procurement shall provide the Supplier with a Valid Exception Code to quote on its invoice instead of the Purchase Order number.
texts.text: B1. The Procurement shall provide the Supplier with a Valid Exception Code to quote on its invoice instead of the Purchase Order number.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. The  Procurement  shall  ensure  the  Finance  returns  invoices  not  having  Purchase  Order number nor exemption code to the Supplier.
texts.text: B2. The  Procurement  shall  ensure  the  Finance  returns  invoices  not  having  Purchase  Order number nor exemption code to the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. The Procurement shall be responsible for verifying and adding goods, services and projects suggested by the End-users.
texts.text: B3. The Procurement shall be responsible for verifying and adding goods, services and projects suggested by the End-users.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.9. Purchase Order Amendments
texts.text: 13.9. Purchase Order Amendments

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement may amend the Purchase Order at the minimum for the following scenarios:
texts.text: The Procurement may amend the Purchase Order at the minimum for the following scenarios:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. When  the  quantity  in  a  Purchase  Order  is  different  than  the  quantity  in  a  purchase requisition.
texts.text: A1. When  the  quantity  in  a  Purchase  Order  is  different  than  the  quantity  in  a  purchase requisition.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. When the value of a Purchase Order is different than the approved value of a purchase requisition.
texts.text: A2. When the value of a Purchase Order is different than the approved value of a purchase requisition.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall not amend the Purchase Order to accommodate the Supplier's delays in executing the scope of work unless some action or instruction from the government entity has caused or contributed to such a delay.
texts.text: The Procurement shall not amend the Purchase Order to accommodate the Supplier's delays in executing the scope of work unless some action or instruction from the government entity has caused or contributed to such a delay.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: When  the  variance  to  the  original  contracted  price  exceeds  the  approved  threshold,  the Procurement shall require approval from the appropriate authority as per the PDoA, for the total of the original agreement and the exceeded variation.
texts.text: When  the  variance  to  the  original  contracted  price  exceeds  the  approved  threshold,  the Procurement shall require approval from the appropriate authority as per the PDoA, for the total of the original agreement and the exceeded variation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall not require approval for amendment if the value between the purchase requisition  and  the  Purchase  Order  is  within  the  defined  Tolerances  to  accommodate  for differences in the estimated value in the purchase requisition and the actual value based on pricing agreed with the Supplier.
texts.text: The Procurement shall not require approval for amendment if the value between the purchase requisition  and  the  Purchase  Order  is  within  the  defined  Tolerances  to  accommodate  for differences in the estimated value in the purchase requisition and the actual value based on pricing agreed with the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement while amending the Purchase Order for the procurement of projects shall verify the agreement of the End-user of the project and if necessary consult with the Tendering Committee. The amendment shall not be issued to accomplish work outside the original business case or plan.
texts.text: The Procurement while amending the Purchase Order for the procurement of projects shall verify the agreement of the End-user of the project and if necessary consult with the Tendering Committee. The amendment shall not be issued to accomplish work outside the original business case or plan.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.10. Purchase Order Cancellation
texts.text: 13.10. Purchase Order Cancellation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  initiate  the  cancellation  of  the  Purchase  Order  under  the  following scenarios:
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  initiate  the  cancellation  of  the  Purchase  Order  under  the  following scenarios:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. When goods, services and projects are not anymore needed by the requestor
texts.text: A1. When goods, services and projects are not anymore needed by the requestor

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. When goods, services and projects change in specification or scope
texts.text: A2. When goods, services and projects change in specification or scope

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. When a Supplier is unable to deliver goods, services and projects as per the agreed delivery conditions
texts.text: A3. When a Supplier is unable to deliver goods, services and projects as per the agreed delivery conditions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  cancel  the  Purchase  Order  in  the  Procurement  Gate  only  after  the purchase requisition is cancelled by the requestor after approvals as per PDoA.
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  cancel  the  Purchase  Order  in  the  Procurement  Gate  only  after  the purchase requisition is cancelled by the requestor after approvals as per PDoA.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.11. Emergency Situations
texts.text: 13.11. Emergency Situations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall allow emergency purchasing after approval as per PDoA, in the following situations:
texts.text: The Procurement shall allow emergency purchasing after approval as per PDoA, in the following situations:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Operational  emergency  -  immediate  disruption  of  operations  resulting  in  significant expense or liability for the government entity, or critical systems are down, or when other assets  and  the  environment  are  under  serious  threat  and  need  to  be  addressed immediately.
texts.text: A1. Operational  emergency  -  immediate  disruption  of  operations  resulting  in  significant expense or liability for the government entity, or critical systems are down, or when other assets  and  the  environment  are  under  serious  threat  and  need  to  be  addressed immediately.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Personal  emergency  -  immediate  danger  to  human  safety  and  health  that  need  to  be addressed immediately.
texts.text: A2. Personal  emergency  -  immediate  danger  to  human  safety  and  health  that  need  to  be addressed immediately.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: An emergency purchase is an exception process, and it may be utilised only to purchase what is necessary to cover the emergency. Emergency purchases are not permitted under any other circumstances.
texts.text: An emergency purchase is an exception process, and it may be utilised only to purchase what is necessary to cover the emergency. Emergency purchases are not permitted under any other circumstances.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users do not use emergency purchase as an excuse for failing to plan. All emergency purchases must be documented in the Procurement Gate and shall be closely scrutinised and reported by the Procurement.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that the End-users do not use emergency purchase as an excuse for failing to plan. All emergency purchases must be documented in the Procurement Gate and shall be closely scrutinised and reported by the Procurement.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.12. Post Factum Purchase Orders
texts.text: 13.12. Post Factum Purchase Orders

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall create post factum Purchase Order when goods, services and projects have been purchased, or commitment to Supplier has been given without authorisation through the Procurement Gate. The post factum Purchase Orders shall be required for all goods, services and projects not a part of the exempted list.
texts.text: The Procurement shall create post factum Purchase Order when goods, services and projects have been purchased, or commitment to Supplier has been given without authorisation through the Procurement Gate. The post factum Purchase Orders shall be required for all goods, services and projects not a part of the exempted list.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall create a post factum Purchase Order only after the purchase requisition has been created with justification and approved by the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.
texts.text: The Procurement shall create a post factum Purchase Order only after the purchase requisition has been created with justification and approved by the appropriate authority as per the PDoA.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.13. Managing Receiving of Goods, Services and Projects
texts.text: 13.13. Managing Receiving of Goods, Services and Projects

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement in coordination with the End-user and other relevant parties shall ensure the receiving of goods, services and projects which at the minimum shall include:
texts.text: The Procurement in coordination with the End-user and other relevant parties shall ensure the receiving of goods, services and projects which at the minimum shall include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Physical receiving
texts.text: A1. Physical receiving

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Inspection and acceptance or rejection
texts.text: A2. Inspection and acceptance or rejection

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Recording in the Procurement Gate
texts.text: A3. Recording in the Procurement Gate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  delivery  note  concerning  Purchase  Order  shall  be  created  by  the  Supplier  for  all  goods, services  and  projects  delivered.  The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  the  End-users  perform receipt against the delivery note immediately after delivery, and any discrepancies or damages are recorded.
texts.text: The  delivery  note  concerning  Purchase  Order  shall  be  created  by  the  Supplier  for  all  goods, services  and  projects  delivered.  The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  the  End-users  perform receipt against the delivery note immediately after delivery, and any discrepancies or damages are recorded.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that the inspection of goods, services and projects is performed by the receiving End-users or subject matter experts responsible for undertaking this task. The inspection shall focus on the quantity and quality of the received goods, services and projects. It shall determine conformance to the acceptance criteria, requirements and terms and conditions of the Purchase Order taking into consideration the Tolerances.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that the inspection of goods, services and projects is performed by the receiving End-users or subject matter experts responsible for undertaking this task. The inspection shall focus on the quantity and quality of the received goods, services and projects. It shall determine conformance to the acceptance criteria, requirements and terms and conditions of the Purchase Order taking into consideration the Tolerances.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure that received goods, executed services and projects are recorded in the Procurement Gate without unnecessary delay. If a partial delivery is made a partial receipt shall be entered.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure that received goods, executed services and projects are recorded in the Procurement Gate without unnecessary delay. If a partial delivery is made a partial receipt shall be entered.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.14. Managing Returns
texts.text: 13.14. Managing Returns

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall manage returns to Suppliers and ensure receiving appropriate credit for the  return.  Returns  shall  be  driven  by  the  need  repair  or  replace  goods  or  non-conforming services and projects.
texts.text: The Procurement shall manage returns to Suppliers and ensure receiving appropriate credit for the  return.  Returns  shall  be  driven  by  the  need  repair  or  replace  goods  or  non-conforming services and projects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure the End-users initiate and request formally for the returns.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure the End-users initiate and request formally for the returns.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall be responsible for:
texts.text: The Procurement shall be responsible for:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C1. Validation of the requests to return
texts.text: C1. Validation of the requests to return

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C2. Coordination of necessary arrangements with the Supplier to obtain a return authorisation
texts.text: C2. Coordination of necessary arrangements with the Supplier to obtain a return authorisation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C3. Arrangement of returns
texts.text: C3. Arrangement of returns

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C4. Communication with Suppliers and the End-users
texts.text: C4. Communication with Suppliers and the End-users

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C5. Ensure receiving appropriate credit for the returns
texts.text: C5. Ensure receiving appropriate credit for the returns

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C6. Recording the return transaction details including the reason for returns
texts.text: C6. Recording the return transaction details including the reason for returns

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.15. Disputes Related to Goods Purchasing
texts.text: 13.15. Disputes Related to Goods Purchasing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall manage all disputes raised by the End-users not limited to the following scenarios:
texts.text: The Procurement shall manage all disputes raised by the End-users not limited to the following scenarios:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Goods shortage
texts.text: A1. Goods shortage

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Goods not as per required specification
texts.text: A2. Goods not as per required specification

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Substitute goods which have not been authorised or approved
texts.text: A3. Substitute goods which have not been authorised or approved

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A4. Goods not conforming to technical specifications
texts.text: A4. Goods not conforming to technical specifications

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A5. Goods not as per required shelf life
texts.text: A5. Goods not as per required shelf life

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A6. Damaged goods
texts.text: A6. Damaged goods

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall ensure receiving the communication about dispute from the End-users. The Procurement shall verify the claims for compensation and may seek advice from the Finance and the Legal if required. The Procurement shall send the notification to the Supplier to replace or provide reimbursement for the goods.
texts.text: The Procurement shall ensure receiving the communication about dispute from the End-users. The Procurement shall verify the claims for compensation and may seek advice from the Finance and the Legal if required. The Procurement shall send the notification to the Supplier to replace or provide reimbursement for the goods.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: If the Supplier raises a dispute to the claim, the Procurement shall facilitate dispute resolution with the Supplier.
texts.text: If the Supplier raises a dispute to the claim, the Procurement shall facilitate dispute resolution with the Supplier.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.16. Disputes Related to Services and Projects Purchasing
texts.text: 13.16. Disputes Related to Services and Projects Purchasing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  the  End-users  raise  disputes  for  services  and  projects purchases covering but not limited to the following scenarios:
texts.text: The  Procurement  shall  ensure  that  the  End-users  raise  disputes  for  services  and  projects purchases covering but not limited to the following scenarios:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A1. Failure to perform or fulfil contractual obligations
texts.text: A1. Failure to perform or fulfil contractual obligations

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards
texts.text: Abu Dhabi Procurement Standards

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A2. Relate to the loss of or damage to property
texts.text: A2. Relate to the loss of or damage to property

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A3. Non-conformance to terms and conditions of the contract
texts.text: A3. Non-conformance to terms and conditions of the contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Disputes related to services and projects shall be resolved similarly as disputes related to goods.
texts.text: Disputes related to services and projects shall be resolved similarly as disputes related to goods.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.17. Invoice Processing
texts.text: 13.17. Invoice Processing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall be responsible for the execution of requisition to pay cycle.
texts.text: The Procurement shall be responsible for the execution of requisition to pay cycle.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Finance shall be authorised for releasing payment to Suppliers. The invoice shall be paid according to the payment terms specified in the order or contract it refers to.
texts.text: The Finance shall be authorised for releasing payment to Suppliers. The invoice shall be paid according to the payment terms specified in the order or contract it refers to.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13.18. Payment Requirements
texts.text: 13.18. Payment Requirements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The Procurement shall facilitate the release of payments to the Suppliers in a timely and accurate manner  upon  verification  of  required  documentation.  The  Procurement  shall  escalate  late payment and missing payments to the Chairman of the government entity.
texts.text: The Procurement shall facilitate the release of payments to the Suppliers in a timely and accurate manner  upon  verification  of  required  documentation.  The  Procurement  shall  escalate  late payment and missing payments to the Chairman of the government entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The  Procurement  while  facilitating  the  release  of  payment  to  Suppliers,  shall  adhere  to  the following:
texts.text: The  Procurement  while  facilitating  the  release  of  payment  to  Suppliers,  shall  adhere  to  the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B1. Purchase Order is approved and executed as per the agreed contractual obligations
texts.text: B1. Purchase Order is approved and executed as per the agreed contractual obligations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B2. The goods, services or projects invoiced must be received, accepted and recorded in the Procurement Gate
texts.text: B2. The goods, services or projects invoiced must be received, accepted and recorded in the Procurement Gate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B3. Payments shall be made as per payment terms specified in the order or contract
texts.text: B3. Payments shall be made as per payment terms specified in the order or contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B4. Payment  value  shall  not  exceed  the  amount  specified  in  the  Purchase  Order  or  its amendments considering the Tolerances specified in the contract
texts.text: B4. Payment  value  shall  not  exceed  the  amount  specified  in  the  Purchase  Order  or  its amendments considering the Tolerances specified in the contract

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B5. Payments shall be made only if relevant supporting documents are attached and verified
texts.text: B5. Payments shall be made only if relevant supporting documents are attached and verified

grid.text: H.E. Ali Rashed Al Ketbi Chairman, Department of Government Support - Abu Dhabi

table_cells.text: Develop procurement workforce with right capacity, capabilities and knowledge ensuring professionalism while providing attractive, competitive career options
Support accountability through the establishment or enhancement of authorities and ensure internal and external control mechanisms are coordinated and integrated into procurement operations
Promote digital technologies and facilitate their adoption and development by enabling access to innovations and emerging digital solutions
Drive cost-effectiveness and improvement in performance of the Procurement through economies of scale, specialisation, and continuous assessment
Deliver efficiency and achieve greater value for money and high level of control through the development of streamlined processes and tools
Facilitate access to procurement opportunities for potential Suppliers through establishing a fair regulatory framework and implementing transparency and open-door attitude

Support integration of the Procurement with relevant organisational functions within the government entity, ensuring services delivered are comprehensive and a seamless flow of operations is maintained
Preserve high standards of integrity and neutrality in the Procurement through the implementation of standards, code of business ethics and internal controls
Ensure continuity and stability of supply through the integration of risk management practices and the establishment of control mechanisms in procurement operations making them sustainable
Ensure an adequate degree of transparency by allowing free access to procurement information, compliance with applicable legislations, and promoting fair treatment of Suppliers

table_cells.text: A set of interrelated documents devised to help procurement professionals in their work.
An integrated set of principles that harmonise the way of working, establish a unified operating model and define the performance of the Procurement.
A formal document defining the roles and committees required for the procurement operations.
A formal document defining division of authority and powers in the government entity related to procurement operations.
A reference document that defines the common and compliant execution of procurement activities for the procurement function of the government entity, in alignment with the Procurement Standards.
An information technology platform of the Procurement, including a portal for internal and external users.
Chairman, Board of Directors or equivalent, in charge of governance of the government entity.
The procurement function existing within or outside the government entity.
Employees of the government entity involved in procuring or making procurement decisions on behalf of the government entity.

Financial benefits such as income, honoraria or equity in the form of stock, stock options or other ownership rights and royalties or payments received by the Procurement Practitioner or his/her spouse, dependants and relatives limited to the second degree of relations.
The requesters or requesting parties of goods, services and projects.
The function within the government entity dedicated to financial affairs.
The function within the government entity dedicated to legal affairs.

table_cells.text: An individual or an organisation registered in the Procurement Gate and licensed to supply the goods, services or projects.
A committee responsible for supervising the procurement function that is appointed by the Chairman of the government entity.
A committee established to evaluate the results of relevant tenders and encourage cross-functional collaboration.
Annual internal plan of the procurement function detailing the outcomes and outputs derived from the procurement strategy, with assigned internal budget and relevant performance measures.
A report issued by the head of the Procurement to report the performance of the procurement function.
A quantifiable measure used to evaluate the success of the government entity or employee in meeting performance objectives.
A reduction in expenditure or consumption either through cost reduction or cost avoidance.
A hierarchical assignment of the goods, services and projects to procurement categories, defined at the organisational level.
The number and size distribution of Suppliers in an industry
A characteristic, trend or condition of the economy that affects the Suppliers commercially
Goods, services and projects requested by the End-users.
A tendering method that is open to all Suppliers, and where the bids are invited through public announcements
A tendering method that is open to predefined number of registered Suppliers
A tendering method where there is only one qualified supplier capable of supplying the required goods, services and projects
A tendering method where only one qualified supplier is invited from a pool of registered suppliers for solicitation

table_cells.text: A guarantee required for the bidding process to mitigate bidding risks. A bid bond ensures that the awarded Supplier will fulfil the commitments of the accepted bid.
An award made to one Supplier.
An award made to every selected Supplier for each part of a divided solicitation.
A type of award where in addition to the selected primary source award is also made to a secondary or backup source of supply.
Awards madetomultiple sources of supply for the samematerials, services and projects.
A type of framework agreement for establishing the terms governing contracts to be awarded during a given period, in particular with regard to the price of goods, services and projects.

A guarantee issued to provide security for satisfactory completion of a contract. A performance bond ensures payment of a sum of money in case of a failure of a Supplier to meet obligations specified in the contract.

Rights or property owned by an individual or organisation or the government entity and legally protected from unauthorised use. Intellectual property may consist of but is not limited to patents, trade secrets, copyrights and trademarks or simply ideas.
Intellectual Property that is relevant to the procured goods, services or projects, supplied by the contracting parties at the beginning of the engagement.
Intellectual Property created during the tenure and framework of the contract between the contracting parties.

A legally binding document issued by the government entity to Suppliers in reference to the Contract or the Price List Agreement or on a standalone basis, indicating key parameters of purchase such as quantities, agreed prices, delivery schedule, payment terms and other relevant information and committing both parties upon explicit or implicit confirmation by Supplier.
Acodegiven to goods, services and projects for which post factum Purchase Orders are allowed to be issued.
Terms that specify the period and modality of payment to the Supplier.
